National Services Scotland Health Protection Scotland
Advanced Healthcare Scientist (Epidemiology and Health Protection)
X4 Permanent posts - 3 Epidemiology, 1 Health Protection
Glasgow

Do you have an interest in improving the health and wellbeing of patients in NHS Scotland?
Perhaps you have relevant experience within the healthcare setting such as health protection, public health or epidemiology?

Why not consider an opportunity to work as a Healthcare Scientist within National Antimicrobial Resistance and Healthcare Associated Infection (ARHAI) Scotland, part of National Services Scotland, we work in partnership to deliver Health Protection services which enable and support a safer and healthier Scotland.

We are seeking to recruit four Advanced Healthcare Scientist (three for Epidemiology and one for Health Protection) to work in the Antimicrobial Resistance & Healthcare Associated Infection (ARHAI) Group. The Group leads and supports efforts to prevent Healthcare Associated Infection (HAI) and contain antimicrobial resistance (AMR) by means of surveillance, guidance development, operational support and training, covering areas such as HAI surveillance, decontamination, microbiological surveillance, research and infection control.

The post holders will provide scientific support to the HAI Surveillance, One Health Antimicrobial Use and Antimicrobial Resistance or Infection Prevention and Control teams. They will assist in the development of a specialised epidemiological and/or scientific knowledge base to underpin one or more health protection programmes of work. They will prepare and disseminate complex, often sensitive, surveillance data and critically appraise the literature to inform evidence-based advice. Also assist with preparation of material to be used in media briefings or in answer to Parliamentary Questions.

The post holders will provide support to the ARHAI Group and collaborate with Public Health Scotland groups involved in this area.

You will be educated to post graduate level, or have experience in health or research field and have a proven track record in epidemiology,

health protection or public health. You will need excellent leadership skills, the ability to analyse and interpret data and be able to communicate effectively with a wide variety of healthcare partners. Knowledge of the NHS would be advantageous. The location of the posts will be Glasgow, however, due to COVID-19 working from home may be required.

Due to current COVID 19 physical (social) distancing measures interviews will be held via MS Teams or SKYPE.

For an informal discussion please contact Sonja Millar on 0141 300 1922

Job Description:
Amazons Inventory Prediction and Entitlement (IPE) team, based in Cambridge, U.K. is looking for passionate, hard-working, and talented individuals to join our fast paced, stimulating environment to help invent the future of business ownership with technology, and to translate big data into actionable insights. The IPE team is part of the Supply Chain Optimization Technology (SCOT) Team within the Operations Organization. The charter of the SCOT team is to maximize Amazons return on our inventory investment in terms of Free Cash Flow and customer satisfaction. We accomplish this through determining of how much inventory Amazon needs of each SKU and what to do if we have too much. This puts the IPE group at the nexus of operations, logistics, capacity planning, and our retail business teams. To learn more about SCOT at Amazon, watch this amazing video: http://bit.ly/amazon-scot.

As an Amazon Senior Data Engineer (Sr. DE), you will be working in one of the world's largest and most complex data warehouse environments. We maintain one of the largest data marts in Amazon as well as work on Business Intelligence reporting and dashboarding solutions that are used by thousands of users world-wide. Our team is responsible for mission critical analytical reports and metrics that are viewed at the highest levels in the organization. We are also working on newer tools that help users discover data using visualization and Big Data technologies.

You should have excellent business and communication skills to be able to work with business owners to develop and define key business questions, and to build data sets that answer those questions. You should be expert at designing, implementing, and operating stable, scalable, low cost solutions to flow data from production systems into the data warehouse and into end-user facing applications. You should be able to work with business customers in a fast paced environment understanding the business requirements and implementing reporting solutions. Above all you should be passionate about working with huge data sets and someone who loves to bring datasets together to answer business questions and drive change. You will work in a team of Software Engineers, Data Scientists, Data Engineers, Researchers, and Product Managers, across multiple teams.

· Explore and learn the latest AWS technologies to provide new capabilities and increase efficiency.

Experience in managing cutting edge bioinformatics systems and software.

Job Title: Postdoctoral Research Scientist in Stem Cell Biology (Epigenetics)
Job Description:
We are seeking a talented, inquisitive, highly motivated and enthusiastic Postdoctoral Research Scientist interested in studying novel mechanisms of pluripotency regulation. The successful candidate will be working with Dr Maria Christophorou and will conduct research at the crossroads of stem cell and developmental biology, cell signalling and epigenetics. The post is ideal for a scientist with a strong background in one of these areas, who is ready to explore new avenues in science and has an interest in expanding their expertise into the other areas.

The Christophorou lab is housed within the Epigenetics department, with affiliation to the Cell Signalling department, and aims to understand how environmental signals are translated into the genomic and epigenetic changes that underpin cell fate and identity.

The successful candidate will build on previous work (Christophorou et al., Nature, 2014) and exciting new data from the Christophorou lab to uncover the mechanisms through which the citrullinating enzymes peptidylarginine deiminases (PADIs) regulate the establishment of pluripotency. They will join a small team of dynamic, inclusive and enthusiastic scientists with diverse expertise and a passion for understanding mammalian biology and exploring new cell biological mechanisms. The successful candidate will be versatile and willing to learn and adapt to the needs of the project.

Applicants should have (or be close to obtaining) a PhD in Cell and Developmental Biology, Biochemistry or similar discipline and a strong background in stem cell biology and/or cell signaling. They should be able to work independently to drive their project but also have a collaborative approach, working productively in a team and contributing to a good social environment in the laboratory. Excellent written and oral communication skills are essential for this position.

Applicants with first author or co-author publications, or work completed for publication, will be highly preferable. Applications for competitive postdoctoral fellowships are highly encouraged and will receive support and mentoring.

Funding for this position is available for three years in the first instance.

A full job specification and role requirements can be found attached to this vacancy.

For more information on the work of the group, please visit here.

Informal enquiries may be directed to Dr. Maria Christophorou (maria.christophorou@babraham.ac.uk).

Applicants must hold a PhD or have their thesis submitted when commencing the post. Please note that you will be appointed on the starting salary of £30,000 per annum, if you have not yet been awarded your PhD.

Closing date for applications is Thursday, 16th July 2020.

NO AGENCIES PLEASE

Working environments and flexible working

We understand that the working environment is important to our colleagues, which is why we ensure that our offices are bright, modern places to work. We have offices in London, Belfast, Edinburgh and Cardiff, as well as field operations offices in Merseyside and Surrey.

Ofcom has introduced an agile working model, making changes to our offices to transform how we work. Colleagues are free to move around our offices, enabling them to work alongside and collaborate with other teams and groups.

We are also moving towards a location-neutral approach to filling our roles. This means colleagues can be based at any of our offices. All of these initiatives help Ofcom colleagues to work flexibly in way that suits them.

We also believe that we have a part to play in protecting the environment around us. We are committed to reducing our carbon footprint and have introduced initiatives to help us consume less energy, including a cycle-to-work scheme and a car-share scheme.

Purpose of the Role

The analysis and interpretation of data is vital for us to deliver our regulatory duties. We are looking for someone who can fulfil a valuable junior role in our crucial process of building, developing and maintaining our data management systems and to help us get the best from data.

We need someone who can work with colleagues in the Data Innovation Hub, and with others across the organisation, to understand requirements and then put in place the necessary automated systems to extract, transform and load the data sets for subsequent analysis, to support the continuous improvement of standards and provide technical guidance alongside other data engineering functions.

Requirements of the Role
Work collaboratively with colleagues in the Hub, policy and operations teams to understand how they use data
Build, deploy and proactively maintain systems to extract, transform and load (ETL) data
Maintain and further develop our application programming interfaces (APIs), which provide data to a range of stakeholders
Continuously seek ways in which to improve our data systems and pipelines to be in line with industry best practice
Work as part of a team to develop initiatives to locate, catalogue and, where appropriate, integrate data sets
Provide our data scientists and analysts with the data and infrastructure required to undertake their analysis
Develop systems that are compliant with our relevant information security and data management principles
Support our work in advising colleagues how data can be used to effectively provide information to consumers
Take responsibility for effective and timely delivery of information from internal and external stakeholders
Skills, knowledge and experience

Applicants should be able to demonstrate capability in:
Developing, coding, testing, correcting and documenting programs or scripts
Using technical tools such as Python, C++, Java, PHP and Spark
Use of environments such as PostgreSQL, Cosmos and Azure
Communicating technical concepts across organisational and technical boundaries
Working independently, demonstrating flexibility and adaptability
Identifying with, and demonstrating a desire to promote, Ofcom's values of excellence, agility, empowerment and collaboration
Experience
Experience of information management and collection processes
Experience of engineering data processes, which transform raw data into a state fit for subsequent analysis
Experience of working across organisational boundaries to understand requirements, translate these requirements into technical specifications and deliver business outcomes
Experience in presenting clear insights to colleagues to support the end use of the data
Qualifications
Technically qualified in a computer science subject or with equivalent experience

Machine Learning Scientist
Nuffield Department of Women's & Reproductive Health, Level 3 Womens Centre, John Radcliffe Hospital, Oxford
Grade 8: £41,526 - £49,533 with a discretionary range to £54,131 p.a.
We invite applications for a Machine Learning scientist to join the Deep Medicine programme at the Nuffield of Women's and Reproductive Health. The programme is focused on tackling major healthcare problems - in both policy and practice - with the application of modern machine learning solution to large multi-modal medical data (e.g., medical records, environmental data and wearables).

This role will provide a unique opportunity to enjoy research in machine learning and health care; grow and be challenged in a multi-disciplinary environment; and create game-changing solutions for health care. It further offers a great opportunity to develop a high-profile academic career, through taking a leadership role in the field of healthcare/biomedical informatics.

This position is a part replacement for a RCUK funded 'PEAK Urban' position (1 year) with an additional 1-year funding from the Oxford Martin School/GRCF-funded Informal Cities programme. These programmes focus on work related to understanding of health and health inequalities in the context of urbanisation. Working across disciplines and geographical borders, this offers an opportunity to transfer and apply tools and techniques from machine learning to better understand the impact of urban systems on health, while contributing to the broader goals of the Deep Medicine.

The candidate will work closely with an excellent team of data scientists, epidemiologists, engineers and clinical researchers.

You will hold a PhD/DPhil in computer science, statistics, mathematics, engineering or another relevant area, have scientific expertise in the applications of machine learning techniques in biomedical and health informatics, a proven track record of academic excellence and experience in statistical analysis, experimental design, Randomised Controlled Trials (RCTs) and causal inference. Advanced programming skills in Python and/or R and practical experience in preparing data for Machine Learning are essential along with excellent communication skills and enthusiasm. A good understanding of bio signal and wearable technologies and Digital phenotyping methodologies is desirable.

This position is full-time and fixed-term for 2 years. Applications for flexible working arrangements are welcomed and will be considered in line with business needs.

What is Slice?

Slice is the leading technology and marketing platform made exclusively for local pizzerias, making it super easy to order delicious, authentic local pizza anywhere, anytime. We serve the $44 billion U.S. pizzeria market in two ways: by providing a pizza-centric mobile and web ordering experience for consumers, and by empowering local restaurants with the technology, tools, and marketing to grow their business, while helping them compete with Big Pizza. Can you imagine what a small mom and pop pizza shop could achieve with the resources of Domino’s?

Slice was born in 2011 and has quietly bootstrapped its way to building a network of more than 10,000 pizzerias nationwide. Ilir Sela, our founder and CEO, started the company as a passion project to help his friends and family in the pizza business, but he quickly saw a massive opportunity to champion these small businesses by bringing their bites to the masses. Ilir has since built an amazing team of operators, marketers, technologists, and investors — all dedicated to making it easier for people to enjoy their favourite local pizza.

What you’ll do.
Leverage your quantitative expertise to understand how Slice can apply supply and demand levers to unlock marketplace opportunities; techniques will include experiment design, predictive modelling, observational analysis, pattern recognition and any others as needed
Partner with Product and Marketing teams to set clear goals, measure progress against them and influence their respective roadmaps
Ensure consistent tracking, analysis, and reporting of core product and marketing programs and channel KPIs in weekly dashboards
Build and maintain executive dashboards in Looker
Improve the accessibility and organisation of data
Collaborate with Data Engineering to understand all data flows, build new flows as needed and create appropriate data dictionaries for business users
Simplify complex raw data into user friendly explores, looks, and dashboards for audiences across the organization
Perform complex ad-hoc data and analysis requests
What we're looking for:
BSc in a quantitative discipline (MSc preferred)
4+ years of specialised experience in Data Science or Advanced Analytics solving complex analytical problems in a technology environment
Proficiency in Python and SQL
Fluency in at least one statistical software (R preferred), Excel and at least one visualisation tool (Looker, Mode, Tableau, etc.)
Strong data modelling and transformation skills
Excellent verbal and written communication skills
Strong communication skills
Able to clearly express opinions on product design, while respecting the thoughts and opinions of their peers.
Proven ability to communicate and collaborate effectively with engineers and non-engineering stakeholders alike
Interested?

We operate like a startup, so being self-motivated, curious, and flexible is a good start. You prefer to come up with your own solutions to problems but are not afraid to ask for help. You enjoy making suggestions for how to improve our product and business, no matter the department. You’re the kind of person who roots for the underdog. And lastly, this job will probably be a lot easier if you have a soulmate-level love for authentic pizza.

Why Slice?

Join a community of best-in-class engineers who combine creativity, curious minds and a commitment to excellence with the desire and commitment to grow and build on the engineering skill base and community here in NI. Job Title: Postdoctoral Research Scientist/Senior Postdoctoral Research Scientist In Bioinformatics/Immunology
Job Description:
Role overview

This is an exciting opportunity for a Postdoctoral Research Scientist or Senior Postdoctoral Scientist to join the Liston lab in the Lymphocyte Signalling and Development strategic programme at The Babraham Institute. The role will be responsible for leading the development of data analysis methods and bioinformatics pipelines for immunology projects.

Applicants will have a PhD in mathematics, computer science or bioinformatics. For those with additional postdoctoral experience, a more senior position with added responsibilities is available. Applicants from diverse academic backgrounds are encouraged to apply, immunology experience is not essential. Experience at being embedded in a wet-lab environment, prior work on flow cytometry or single-cell RNA-seq data, or experience in machine learning will all be considered strong assets.

This job is ideal for a strong mathematical candidate who wants to apply their knowledge to biological problems. The successful candidate will work as part of a wet/dry mixed lab, develop novel tools, analyse data, create mathematical models and aid in the design of experiments to test those models. The job has potential career development into a long-term staff scientist, or would suit candidates looking to develop skills for an independent position.

This is a limited term appointment with funding for this post expected to be available for a period of 18 months.

A full job specification and role requirements can be found attached to this vacancy.

For more information on the work of the group, please visit here.

Applicants must hold a PhD or have their thesis submitted when commencing the post. Please note that you will be appointed on the starting salary of £30,000 per annum, if you have not yet been awarded your PhD.

Closing date for applications is Thursday, 16th July 2020.

NO AGENCIES PLEASE

As an organisation we are embarking on an ambitious growth strategy in location data, insight and services. Innovating our products, services and technology to benefit our customers, businesses and people across Great Britain and globally. In order to do this, we want to continue adding new skills and capabilities to our business and even in these tough times, we’re able to use technology to recruit talent to OS.

About Us

Ordnance Survey Limited (OS) is the national mapping agency for Great Britain, and a world-leading geospatial data and technology organisation. As a reliable partner to government, business and citizens across Britain and the world, OS helps its customers in virtually all sectors improve quality of life. OS expertise and data supports efficient public services and infrastructure, new technologies in transport and communications, national security and emergency services and exploring the great outdoors.

Imagine working for an organisation which has been innovating and pushing boundaries for over two centuries – and continues to do so today. A company full of unique expertise and skill, with a host of exciting and innovative opportunities to pursue. A business which is making a real difference to lives, communities and businesses everywhere. Ordnance Survey provides world-renowned data and services which underpin critical activities across government and the commercial sector, while continually expanding its horizons both internationally and into the future.

About the Role

This is an opportunity for a Senior Data Scientist to oversee our PSGA Technical Support activities within our Data Science & Analytics team at Ordnance Survey - to provide expert geospatial data science support to government combined with leadership across a variety of data science projects.

In this role, you will use your skills and experience to provide expert geospatial data science support to government, working closely with government data scientists, analysts, statisticians and others to solve geospatial problems across the whole public sector – from the centre of government in Whitehall to individual Local Authorities. For this role, you must be willing and able to travel regularly, especially to and from London, to meet face-to-face* with external customers. You may also be required to undertake longer-term secondments into other parts of government: Ordnance Survey is looking to support government policy-making by embedding geospatial data experts directly into government projects, and you must be willing to be part of this (alongside other members of your team). You will also be required to undergo Developed Vetting (DV) security clearance, if you have not done so already, to ensure that you are able to support any projects that may arise in future – regardless of sensitivity.
note that face-to-face meetings and travel will not be required during the current Covid-19 epidemic; during this extraordinary period, only remote/online customer meetings will be taking place.
You will be highly customer focused, always considering the customer business problem in everything you do and working as closely with customers as possible at every stage. You will provide expert advice to customers and stakeholders in applying geospatial analysis, data-mining techniques and data modelling to optimise decisions within government, and will provide thought-leadership, consultancy and technical expertise to government customers in geospatial data analytics and implementation.

You will also be a natural innovator – always seeking to try out new ideas, and you will regularly undertake rapid proof of concept work for new and innovative propositions involving data. We’ll be looking to our senior data scientists as a rich source of new ideas and inventions – some of which will grow to become new products or services from Ordnance Survey into government.

Finally, you will manage a team of highly motivated, highly skilled and similarly minded geospatial data scientists and will work with them to meet Ordnance Survey’s customer support commitments to government (at levels 3 and 4 as set out within the Public Sector Geospatial Agreement), as well as representing Ordnance Survey’s data science capabilities through meetings, presentations and project work with government customers.

About You

You will be able to demonstrate evidence against these key criteria;

Degree level qualification in a quantitative discipline or significant experience in a relevant field
Prior experience in a data science role involving geospatial data
Expert in working with geospatial vector data and a passion for solving problems with all kinds of data
Track record of working with external customers and internal stakeholders to solve customer business problems using data
Strong database and programming skills (including at least one of: Python, Scala, R)
Track record in the application of machine learning and big data technologies
Positive and collaborative work ethic
Excellent ability to communicate and present complex subject matter in an accessible manner
Excellent and confident engagement, presentation and communication skills
Experience of managing people
Experience of working with more than one government department
Willingness to travel (especially to London) on a regular basis
Willingness to undergo “Developed Vetting” security clearance

About the Rewards

We want you to love what you do. That’s why our benefits package rewards a job well done. We’ll give you:

Salary – £52,700-£58,900
Performance related bonus
Competitive pension
37 hour working week
25 days annual leave - (30 days after five years) bank holidays and an extra 3 over Christmas
Training and development – We offer in-house training, a variety of masterclasses, bespoke training, study leave, access to learning resources and professional membership subscriptions
A wide range of additional benefits including free parking, paid volunteer day, support with health and wellbeing, sports and social activities, staff discount on over 500 national stores and more

Location:
This role will be based at our HQ in Southampton

Closing date - July 12th 2020

About Us

Ordnance Survey is committed to making inclusion an everyday reality and promoting a diverse workforce. Each individual at OS brings their own perspectives, work experiences, lifestyles, and cultures with them, and we believe that a more diverse team builds more innovative products, provides a better service to our customers, and helps us all grow and learn as individuals.

Check out our careers video below and hear from OS employees about what life is like to work here!

In light of the recent communication from the World Health Organisation declaring COVID-19 as a pandemic, if you have been in known contact with anyone with the Coronavirus, are recovering from the virus or have relatable symptoms we ask you to notify the OS Resourcing team at careers@os.uk immediately prior to attendance of your interview to discuss alternate options during the recruitment process.

If you have any questions or queries please contact careers@os.co.uk.

Job Summary

The Cell Line Engineering Group is looking for a highly skilled Senior Scientist to help drive the delivery of both standard and complex in vitro gene-editing projects for our customers. You will plan, design and execute Molecular and Cellular Biology activities as part of our genome engineering pipeline and report on the results to managers. You will act as a role model for junior scientists to follow from the bench to the desk.

This is a lab-based role and candidates should be highly self-motivated, pro-active, able to work to tight timelines and be comfortable working under pressure in an environment with shifting priorities.

Key Responsibilities
Work collaboratively with other team members to perform the required lab activities to ensure our client projects move forward within the expected timelines and specifications
Analyse and interpret the results of such activities; identify and solve problems from both a molecular and cellular biology perspective
Make key decisions on laboratory activities and be accountable to management for those decisions
Drive forward process improvements within the pipeline
Act as a mentor to more junior laboratory staff
Help management directing day-to-day laboratory activities
Report on milestone delivery
Essential Competencies & Requirements
Extensive experience in cell culture to include induced pluripotent stem cells (iPSCs), primary cells and cpom complex cellular models
PhD or equivalent experience in a relevant molecular/cellular biology field and additional experience in the biotechnology/pharmaceutical industry
Experience with virus generation and infection (lentivirus, rAAV, adenovirus)
Strong experience in in vitro gene editing using one or more cell engineering technologies rAAV, CRISPR, ZFN, TALENs, ideally in IPSCs
Good molecular biology skills and a good understanding of genetics and genotyping
Ability to manage multiple complex projects within the laboratory
Excellent interpersonal and communication skills
Excellent organisational ability to plan and prioritise work
Good attention to detail and ability to keep accurate records
Closing date 2nd August 2020

Our vision is to unlock the power of the cell, and we are increasing our focus on customers everyday. Our unique tools and services are used by our customers to provide valuable insights and applications in - research, drug discovery, molecular diagnostics and biomanufacturing.

Company Description

The Rank Group is growing rapidly within both our Venues and Digital businesses. If you’re not sure who we are, you may be more familiar with us through our iconic brands; Mecca Bingo and Grosvenor Casino. We have most recently acquired Stride Gaming, which, together with our existing Digital business, forms Rank Interactive. We employ circa 8,000 people globally, with our UK office functions being located in Maidenhead (Head Office), Sheffield (Customer Solutions Hub), London (Digital) and a further office in Gibraltar, which is home to our existing Rank Digital function. We are evolving as a business and are adding some exciting new brands and concepts to our venues and digital offering. By joining an office-based or operational function with us, you’ll instantly be part of a high-performing and inclusive culture, which works closely to support our Customer-facing teams.

Job Description

As a Data Modeler within our Data and Analytics function, you will play a pivotal role in technically delivering our data and analytical product alongside a talented multi-disciplinary team comprising of business and data analysts, ELT developers, customer insight teams, data scientists and BI developers. You will be passionate about working with data and ensuring we build products that exposes the value of that data.

Main Accountabilities and Responsibilities
Transforming complex business structures, processes and activities into technical solutions
Build out our data lake and transform our data into usable data views e.g. Target Data Model with a Single Customer view of the customer.
Design, build and support scalable, high performance data applications, repositories and data governance related applications
Contribute to the definition of data architecture standards and establish best practices for data management (including the handling of Personally Data)
Design and implement logical and physical data models across platforms
Manage equivalent, separate data sets across different development and staging environments as part of our release process
Seek out opportunities to propose new concepts and ideas in ‘Big Data’ and expand existing platforms or leverage new technologies to meet more complex business needs
Help mentoring the more junior developers and analysts in data product development
Qualifications
Degree qualified
Proven project experience in modelling and evolving complex data structures
Solid understanding of data warehousing principles, concepts and best practices (e.g. ODS, Data Warehousing, Data Lakes, Kimball, Zachmann, TOGAF)
Solid experience of documentation ( Design documentation and Source to Target Mappings)
Strong SQL/ T-SQL / SSIS and data profiling skills
Previously worked on a ”Big Data platform”, enabling non-technical users to gain insight into key business metrics
Hands on experience with modern "Big Data" systems (e.g. Azure Data Warehouse, Azure Analysis Services, Azure Data Factory. Snowflake is a bonus)
Excellent knowledge of data formats including JSON, XML, CSV etc.
Familiarity with a traditional BI application such as Power BI,
Hands-on ELT experience using tools like WhereScape Red, WhereScape 3D
Experience working with both modern compiled and dynamic / scripting languages: e.g. Python, R
Strong problem solving and analytic skills
Comfortable working in a fast paced dynamic environment with a certain degree of uncertainty
Master Data Management and Data Governance experience.
Additional Information

Personal Qualities
Demonstrates sense of passion and pride about own work. Positive attitude and adapts well to change. Inspires passion and excitement around shared goals, promoting environment of achievement.
Demonstrates the ability to motivate and influence teams and individuals with whom there is no direct or indirect management responsibility
Able to articulate a compelling vision, and effectively manages self / others through ambiguity.
Excellent presentation, written and verbal communications skills
Proven ability to evaluate business specifications, design in detail all data solutions necessary and provide technical guidance to other members of a project team
Experience of working effectively with both business and technical stakeholders

Excellent opportunity for a Data & Digitalisation Team Lead who will lead a team of data scientists, analysts and engineers to undertake delivery of a broad portfolio of R&D projects, programmes and commercial services driving continued reduction in the levelised cost of energy (LCoE) from offshore wind farms.

The team supports the continued evolution of the offshore renewable energy sector; improving performance, reliability and utilisation capabilities for owner operators.

They provide value-added analysis and procedural development to accelerate data-driven decision making from concept through to real-world application strategies. Supporting an extensive portfolio of innovators, manufacturers and owner operators, their goal is to incentivise the UK supply chain, realising world-class status within the global Offshore Renewable Energy Sector.

The successful candidate for this position will likely come from a strong data and digital background preferably with, however not limited to an engineering bias. A unique opportunity to make a game-changing difference to an already revolutionary industry.

You will lead, inspire and develop your team, empowering them with the autonomy to challenge perceptions driving innovation through data and digital solutions. In a market that is growing exponentially the continued professional development of your team is crucial to building upon their existing success

With well-developed leadership and team management skills, you will be accountable for the development, deployment and maintenance of the team strategy, creating real-world solutions for the ever-evolving requirements of their pioneering client base. Commercially focussed, you will approach their portfolio of projects with a Return on Investment (ROI) mindset, maintaining a keen focus on the value.

A passion for the sector coupled with a keen interest in continuous improvement will support the successful candidate in developing and maintaining a currency of knowledge of the latest developments across the sector.

As Data & Digitalisation Team Lead you will build mutually beneficial partnerships with UK businesses and innovators, ensuring activities remain relevant to the challenges faced by their clients. Collaboration with Business Development Teams will assist in defining the vision for your team and assisting the O&M activities of the UK Supply Chain in realising world-class status.

This position will be the technical authority behind the Data & Digitalisation Team, responsible for the delivery of Data & Digitalisation research projects, you’ll ensure a high quality of accurate work is delivered on time and within budget.

The successful candidate will possess highly developed interpersonal skills and will have proven experience of leading and inspiring others concerning digital solutions. This is a rare chance to develop and promote pioneering insights and methodologies which leave a lasting, positive legacy in the development of the UK Renewable Energy Supply Chain.

Experience required

• Minimum of Five (5) years professional experience in a relevant discipline

• Educated to degree level in a relevant discipline

• Extensive knowledge and experience of applied data and digital technology applications

• Knowledge of the renewables sector (i.e. electrical/mechanical plant, planning and consent, commissioning, operations and maintenance, operational performance, power performance assessment, decommissioning)

• Experience in project or resource management

• Experience leading innovative and technical projects and staff

• Proven stakeholder management skills – owning proposals, negotiate and collaborate where appropriate, maximising value for the organisation and the industry

• Motivated and strong team player

• Excellent interpersonal and communication skills with demonstrable experience at all levels

• Proficient in standard software packages including MS Word, MS Excel, MS Outlook

• Familiarity with some or all of the following software languages; Python, SQL, Matlab, Octave, Powershell, PowerBI, ArcGIS

Package:

An excellent remuneration package is offered which includes attractive basic salary, pension, bonus, and subsidised health care saving scheme.

The successful candidate must be in easily comutable distance to their office in Grimsby and you can also have the opportunity to WFM

Fantastic Opportunity to work in NHS National Services Scotland

National Services Scotland Health Protection Scotland
Advanced Healthcare Scientist (Epidemiology and Health Protection)
X4 Permanent posts - 3 Epidemiology, 1 Health Protection
Glasgow

Do you have an interest in improving the health and wellbeing of patients in NHS Scotland?
Perhaps you have relevant experience within the healthcare setting such as health protection, public health or epidemiology?

Why not consider an opportunity to work as a Healthcare Scientist within National Antimicrobial Resistance and Healthcare Associated Infection (ARHAI) Scotland, part of National Services Scotland, we work in partnership to deliver Health Protection services which enable and support a safer and healthier Scotland.

We are seeking to recruit four Advanced Healthcare Scientist (three for Epidemiology and one for Health Protection) to work in the Antimicrobial Resistance & Healthcare Associated Infection (ARHAI) Group. The Group leads and supports efforts to prevent Healthcare Associated Infection (HAI) and contain antimicrobial resistance (AMR) by means of surveillance, guidance development, operational support and training, covering areas such as HAI surveillance, decontamination, microbiological surveillance, research and infection control.

The post holders will provide scientific support to the HAI Surveillance, One Health Antimicrobial Use and Antimicrobial Resistance or Infection Prevention and Control teams. They will assist in the development of a specialised epidemiological and/or scientific knowledge base to underpin one or more health protection programmes of work. They will prepare and disseminate complex, often sensitive, surveillance data and critically appraise the literature to inform evidence-based advice. Also assist with preparation of material to be used in media briefings or in answer to Parliamentary Questions.

The post holders will provide support to the ARHAI Group and collaborate with Public Health Scotland groups involved in this area.

You will be educated to post graduate level, or have experience in health or research field and have a proven track record in epidemiology,

health protection or public health. You will need excellent leadership skills, the ability to analyse and interpret data and be able to communicate effectively with a wide variety of healthcare partners. Knowledge of the NHS would be advantageous. The location of the posts will be Glasgow, however, due to COVID-19 working from home may be required.

Due to current COVID 19 physical (social) distancing measures interviews will be held via MS Teams or SKYPE.

For an informal discussion please contact Sonja Millar on 0141 300 1922

Our benefits package includes pension scheme, comprehensive range of work life balance policies, occupational health services, learning resource centres and discounted leisure, financial and shopping benefits.

Further information on NSS is available from: www.nhsnss.org

Location: Cambridge, UK
Area: Analytics

We have a vacancy at scientist level for a protein biochemist/chemist in our busy Analytics group in Cambridge (UK). This is a lab-based role in which you will be working as part of a team on client-facing projects and will have the opportunity to learn new techniques in a fast-paced but supportive environment.

Abzena provides the most complete set of solutions in integrated early discovery to mid-phase biotherapeutic and ADC drug development services in the pharmaceutical industry. Working with companies and academic groups all over the world, including most of the top 20 biopharmaceutical companies, Abzena supports the development and manufacture of better treatments for patients. Multiple antibodies which have been created using Abzena’s technologies are currently being progressed through clinical development by our partners.

To support the company’s biotherapeutic research activities the Analytics lab in Cambridge is equipped with state-of-the-art instrumentation including UPLC chromatography, microfluidics capillary electrophoresis, dynamic light scattering platforms, and high-resolution Q-TOF, high sensitivity TOF, and Orbitrap mass spectrometers.

You will have a minimum of a BSc in protein biochemistry or similar area, ideally with experience in an industrial or commercial environment. An in-depth understanding of protein analytics coupled with practical research experience is essential for this role. We would be interested to hear from candidates with experience of protein formulation or protein degradation pathway research. You will be able to work both independently and as part of a team, have good planning and organising skills and be confident in the use of IT, especially MS Office.

In addition, you will have a high level of attention to detail and be able to identify and analyse routine and complex problems and resolve routine issues. You will be proactive, adaptable and independent, with a high level of autonomy and initiative.

At Abzena we recognise the importance of learning within teams and actively encourage staff to coach and mentor others, in order to pass on knowledge and develop the skills of more junior staff.

In return, we can offer you a competitive salary and benefits package and a collaborative, varied and challenging environment where you will be encouraged to step outside your comfort zone and develop your career.

Main Duties and Responsibilities

Professional / Technical

Performing routine laboratory assays in support of client-based projects.
Carrying out tasks accurately and following strict methodologies (SOPs, or WI).
Preparing samples, buffers and solvents for HPLC and other assays.
Performing standard HPLC and capillary electrophoretic assays for complex protein samples.
Performing routine interpretation of complex analytical data sets.
Assisting the setting up of new offerings involving formulation development, and in silico manufacturability assessment through ex vivo serum stability.
Ensuring the laboratories are well-stocked and resourced.
Recording and interpreting results to present to senior lab members.
Keeping up to date with technical developments.
Conducting searches on identified topics relevant to the research.
Following and ensuring strict safety procedures and safety checks.

Interpersonal / Team

To keep their supervisor and Group Leader informed of work progress in a timely fashion.
To proactively support other laboratory scientists.
To attend and contribute to relevant meetings.
To manage their own work and tasks.

Systems / Procedures

To ensure that responsibilities identified within internal processes, such as Health and Safety guidelines and SOPs, are robustly met by all research team members and that such processes are reviewed in a timely fashion.
To draft SOPs.
To keep accurate records and document all research findings in accordance with company policy.
Key Competencies

Qualifications/Experience

Essential:
Minimum of a BSc. degree in Protein Biochemistry or a related science discipline together with relevant laboratory experience.

Desirable:
Experience in an industrial environment, or PhD in a relevant discipline.
In-depth knowledge of protein analytics including CE-SDS, CZE, SEC-HPLC, reversed phase HPLC, and cation exchange HPLC.
Knowledge or experience of biopharmaceutical formulation development or antibody degradation pathways.
Application of light scattering technologies to protein characterisation.

Skills & Knowledge

Essential:
Excellent technical skills.
Ability to plan own work in order to meet the project objectives in a timely fashion.
Ability to exercise a high level of initiative.
Demonstrate excellent interpersonal and communication skills
Ability to identify and analyse routine problems and issues.

Desirable:
A good understanding of the research environment in biotech and pharma industry.

Personal Qualities

Essential:
Adaptable and proactive independent attitude.
Good team player with a positive nature.

MagicLab is expanding its analytical function again. We are looking for experienced analysts to be part of an established team. You will be joining a team of ten bright and savvy analysts and data scientists to work on a wide range of data challenges: evaluate product features, user behavioural pattern mining, A/B test results, PR materials and fun facts, revenue / user churn predictions, competitor reports, effect of marketing campaigns, social media data scraping and sentiment analysis (NLP), forecasting models and much, much more.

If you want to work with some of the most exciting technologies for big data, this is your chance! We constantly review and extend our tool stack to remain current. Continuous learning is a crucial part of the job. We participate regularly in conferences, meetups, trainings and internal hackathons. If many of the following speak to you, we would like to hear from you!
RESPONSIBILITIES/JOB ROLE
Manipulate complex datasets using a range of tools such as Python, SQL, Hive and Spark
Deliver actionable insights to product, marketing, billing, engineering and operations teams
Perform analysis across a variety of data topics and help solve challenges such as interpreting split test results, predicting user behaviours and finding top performing user segments
Take the lead on new exploratory research projects in a wide variety of areas
Contribute to ongoing infrastructure improvements, e.g. our Badoo Python library
REQUIRED EXPERIENCE, KNOWLEDGE AND SKILLS
Strong commercial experience querying, analysing and providing insights from large datasets (100 TB+), preferably in online/tech industry
Advanced SQL: analytic functions, performance tuning, data wrangling
Python: pandas, scikit-learn, statsmodels, IPython/JupyterData Visualisation: D3.js, matplotlib, seaborn, plotly, ggplot (any of the above)
Experience in A/B testing analysis: significance analysis, non-parametric methods, bootstrapping
Ability to engage well with other parts of the business such as developers, product managers and senior management
Experience in presenting findings to varying audiences (technical and non-technical stakeholders) and catering presentation style appropriately
A strong attention to detail and a clear and concise writing style
DESIRED EXPERIENCE, KNOWLEDGE AND SKILLS
Hadoop, Hive, Spark, Exasol R
MicroStrategy or other BI platform
Data Modeling
Machine Learning: predictive models (Regression, GLM, Bayes, GBDT), clustering, NLP
Version Control experience: Git, SVN
Why MagicLab?

We are proud to be the largest dating network in the world, with over 500 million users across 190 countries. Online dating has more than doubled in the last decade, and it is estimated that the global online dating market could be worth $12 billion next year. We continually innovate so that we can provide the best technology and user experience for people to meet because we believe that happiness is better shared.

Personalis is a high quality genomics services provider with a mission to pioneer genome-guided medicine in immunotherapy. Our priority is to obtain the most accurate genetic data from each patient sample by utilizing our proprietary technology and customer-focused data delivery process. Our assays are based on whole human exome and transcriptome sequencing, conducted in our state-of-the art laboratory. We incorporate proprietary databases, sophisticated algorithms, and customizable reporting.

Personalis provides pharmaceutical, biotech, and academic researchers an accurate and comprehensive end-to-end human genome sequencing and analysis solution for clinical trials and translational research needs in immuno-oncology. Headquartered in Menlo Park, CA, we are seeking a talented and highly motivated Field Applications Scientist (mainland Europe) to join our Team.

Summary

The Field Applications Scientist is the scientific expert in oncology, clinical and research practices, and competitor landscape. This position will be a member of a cross-disciplinary team in support of sales and business development efforts and assisting in conducting customer meetings, seminars and demonstrations for a range of Personalis products. This position is an integral part of the marketing effort, generating analytical data for use in marketing material, trade shows, publications and technical briefs as well as providing input on new product or application areas. Through their expertise and external interactions, they will gain and share the scientific and technical voice of the customer that will assist in the development and execution of innovative strategies and plans that clearly support development of genomic solutions for researchers and clinicians driving immunotherapy.

Responsibilities

As the scientific expert in our products, the Field Applications Scientist (FAS) will build long-term relationships and establish rapport with principle investigators, researchers, and clinicians in pharma, hospitals/clinics, and academic centers. In particular, the FAS will provide strong support of cancer applications specifically in the Pharma and Biopharma clinical trials and translational research markets through highly scientific product discussions.

The Field Applications Scientist will be a resource to company management regarding market dynamics, alternative testing protocols, business development/risks and customer feedback. Specifically, the Field Applications Scientist will be the primary point of contact for sales support of the Personalis Immuno-oncology portfolio for our European clients (mainland Europe).

Pre-sales support
Provide technical and clinical research input, advice, and support for sales either in person, by phone or by email/web
Travel with sales to customer sites to provide technical/scientific input and give presentations
Help assess customer technical requirements for project proposals
Generation of application specific content for use by sales and marketing (application notes and tech briefs)
Organize and support customer demonstrations at Personalis and customer sites
Develop applications-based scientific posters and presentations and represent Personalis products and services at appropriate scientific tradeshows and conference meetings
Help sales team to assess target customer’s application to prioritize prospecting activities
Post-sales support
Work with Field team to provide support to ensure the application is functioning correctly in the customer’s hands. Provide data review and reporting support to customers
Trouble shoot applications related problems, work with R&D and product managers to transition routine product training to the sales group
Assist existing customers with their needs and questions, interacting with our CRM database and supporting our sales staff
Applications development
Work directly with sales to support customer-specific applications
Work closely with R&D team to link customer application use and experience back into the R&D team for assessment of the needs of any product modifications
Provide applications development leadership in terms of identification and implementation of new applications which may positively impact sales
Requirements
PhD degree in the life sciences required
Expertise in cancer research required (focus in immuno-oncology preferred)
Experience in molecular biology and DNA/RNA sequencing highly desired
Experience in NGS Bioinformatics a plus
Must be technically competent and have good people skills to work with a variety of diverse
clinicians/scientists/customers
Excellent communication skills; both verbally and written. Experience delivering seminars and leading group discussions and data reviews a plus
>50% travel requirement
>2 years of FAS experience (Pharma experience desired)
Demonstrated ability to collaborate with translational research scientists and external collaborators, particularly within the pharma market
Ability to work effectively with cross functional teams including Marketing, R&D, Operations and Sales
Strong desire to work in a demanding, high-energy, hands-on startup environment
Personalis is an equal opportunity employer. Personalis offers a competitive compensation package.

Job Title: Head of Data Science - Revolut for Business (findajob)
Job Description:
Job Title: Head of Data Science - Revolut for Business
Company: Revolut
Location: London
Closing date for the application: August 1st, 2020.
Job type: Full time
Salary: Competitive

WHAT WE NEED
We are looking for an experienced Data Science Leader to build and lead a world-class machine learning and advanced analytics team for Revolut for Business. Our Data Scientists are responsible for applying scientific methodology, statistical inference and machine learning models to drive business decisions. They have strong backgrounds in statistics, applied mathematics, and computer science with the ability to write clean and operationalizable code. They are also creative, inquisitive and exceptional communicators with an aptitude for uncovering hidden patterns and know how to get the most out of the product by making the right decisions with the data.

WHAT YOU’LL BE DOING
• You'll sit within our Business · Core team and have full ownership for data science and analytics across our Business product teams.
• You'll be responsible for creating the road maps and defining the strategies for these teams, collaborating with Product Owners and Business Heads in order to optimise products and improve growth, conversions and engagement analytics for various markets.
• You will hire and manage a team of data scientists, analysts and engineers, creating data-driven solutions using advanced analytical, statistical and machine learning models, and driving projects as a hands on data science leader.

WHAT SKILLS YOU’LL NEED
• Experience building and leading a significant data science team within a scaling organisation
• Practical experience with algorithms for classification, regression, clustering, and anomaly detection
• Excellent knowledge of data science tools, including Python, SQL, and production tools
• Deep understanding of fundamentals of mathematics, probability and statistics
• Big picture thinking - ability to correctly diagnose problems and productionise research
• Excellent communication and collaboration skills to partner with Product Owners and business heads
• STEM (technical) BSc / MSc / PHD from an internationally recognised university
A little about us…When Revolut was founded in 2015, we had a vision to build a sustainable, digital alternative to traditional big banks. Our mission now is to help our customers improve their financial health, empower them to have more control, and promote financial cohesion across the communities in which we operate. Launching into 2020 with 10 million Personal customers and over a quarter of a million Business customers only reinforced our belief in the vast need across the world for better financial services. As our customer base has boomed in the last year, we’ve expanded our team to match that growth. We started 2019 with several hundred employees; we closed it out with 2000.

What we’re looking for…Revolut is being scaled up by people all around the world who share our vision. We’re looking for people who align with our four core values: we Never Settle, we Get It Done because we Think Deeper and we’re Stronger Together. You’re the kind of person who wants to join a community of forward-thinking people, all personally and professionally invested in Revolut’s mission. You thrive in a collaborative space where everyone’s learning from each other, and learning fast. We believe in empowering our Revoluters in their work, giving them autonomy and ownership of what they do. We want everyone at Revolut to own their story and their successes - working with us means you’re not just another cog in the machine.

THE BENEFITS
• Competitive salary
• Biannual equity bonuses
• All the latest tech you need
• Skip the commute and work from home once a week
• Roll with a free Revolut Metal subscription
• Pension plan
• Private health insurance
• Start the day properly with fresh fruit and cereals
• Stay refreshed: get juice, tea, coffee and soft drinks on tap
• Rest up with 29 days’ holiday per year

Cryo-Electron Microscopy Training Scientist

Business Area

Science

Full Time Salary

£33,297 to £39,172 per annum (Discretionary range to £45,048) or £43,790 to £51,517 per annum (Discretionary range to £59,245) for Senior level

Post Type

Full time / Permanent

Closing Date

About Us

Diamond Light Source is the UK’s national synchrotron facility. By accelerating electrons to near light-speed, Diamond generates brilliant beams of light from infra-red to X-rays which are used for both academic and industrial research, across a wide range of scientific disciplines including structural biology, physics, chemistry, materials science, engineering, earth and environmental sciences.

The Electron Bio-Imaging Centre (eBIC) at Diamond provides scientists with state-of-the-art equipment and expertise in the field of cryo-electron microscopy (CryoEM), for single particle analysis, cryo-electron tomography and electron crystallography.

About the Role

We now have an opportunity for a CryoEM Training Scientist to join the growing eBIC team and contribute to the continued success of our world-leading scientific facility.

This role will be essential in supporting eBIC’s user programme by providing both training, workshops and operational support, as well as contributing to in-house research and development projects.

Responsibilities will include:
Providing training to external and in-house users, including sample preparation, microscope operation and data analysis.
Organize regular training workshops in eBIC, and in collaboration with CCP-EM and other cryoEM facilities.
Contributing to day-to-day operations of eBIC by assisting with external user experiments as a local contact.
Actively participating in eBIC reviews including preparation of documentation, contributing to identify areas for improvement.
Developing your own research, in an area relevant to eBIC and disseminating the results.
Giving advice to users on proposal submissions and helping to develop the user community.
You will also coordinate, develop, implement and run a training programmes in cryoEM to suit the variable and evolving needs of eBIC’s user base.

Further responsibilities will include:
Contributing to the management and funding of the eBIC training programme, working with senior eBIC staff to attract external funding through writing of grant proposals.
Contributing to the management of the eBIC training budget.
Collaborating and coordinating with other CryoEM centres and facilities to leverage training resources and aid in the establishment of a UK wide training programme.
Successful applicants will be appointed at either Grade 5 or 4, depending on the strength of your skills, experience and qualifications.

About You

You will have a PhD in science, ideally in the biological/biophysical sciences, or demonstrate significant equivalent experience.

You will demonstrate significant experience in working within a scientific or academic environment, with experience in CryoEM essential, including a track record in CryoEM related research, experience with handling of biological samples, high-resolution data collection and data processing/analysis.

You will also have experience in the operation of transmission electron microscopes especially for structural biology applications, as well as experience with Windows/Linux/Unix.

You should also be able to demonstrate experience of designing and delivering training.

You will display the ability to design, plan, organise and implement projects and tasks within an allotted timeframe, as well as the ability to lead your own research project including budget and resource management.

You will demonstrate exceptional interpersonal, communication and presentation skills, with the ability to interact effectively and diplomatically with staff and facility users at all levels

Benefits

Diamond offers an exceptional benefits package to support staff in achieving a positive work/life balance. This includes 25 days annual leave plus 13 days of statutory and company holidays, along with flexible working hours and an excellent pension scheme. Staff also have access to a range of amenities on site including a nursery, cafes, a restaurant and sports and leisure facilities. A relocation allowance may also be available where applicable.

To Apply

Applicants are required to outline their suitability for this role via the online application process. Please also state where you saw this role advertised.

Diamond is a thriving international organisation, attracting a diverse range of talented individuals from around the world. Our staff currently comprises 39 nationalities and we welcome applications from everyone interested in joining us.

Other information
Company benefits
Life at diamond
Where relevant, and possible for the role, we will consider flexible working arrangements and secondment opportunities.

Diamond attract talented individuals from around the world and currently employ 39 different nationalities. Reflecting trends in our sector we employ more men than women (78% men and 22% women as at 5 April 2019). Therefore, in accordance with law and good practice, we particularly welcome applications from suitably qualified women.

If you are disabled and would like to be considered under the Guaranteed Interview Scheme, please let us know via the online application process.

Diamond are members of Working Families (the UK’s work-life balance organisation), we have also achieved the Athena SWAN Bronze award and Disability Confident Level One.

The Behavioural Genomics group is headed by Dr André Brown in the Quantitative Biology section of the MRC London Institute of Medical Sciences. The group’s research is aimed at understanding how molecular level perturbations affect behaviour. For more information, see the group’s website at https://tierpsy.com/. Current areas of research include high-throughput imaging for phenotypic screening and the development of new behavior analysis methods. We are using this technology for whole-animal drug screens to repurpose drugs for rare diseases and to discover novel neuroactive compounds from diverse natural sources including bacteria and venomous animals.

Main duties / key responsibilities:
Plan and carry out research in accordance with the project aims
Attend project and related research group meetings
Interact and collaborate with group members
Provide training and advice for other group members including PhD students
Publish results in peer-reviewed journals
Take an active part in the academic activities of the LMS
Attend and contribute to journal clubs and seminar presentations
Present data at national and international meetings
Form good working relationships with other members of the group as well as internal and external collaborators

Additional information:
This post is a MRC Postdoctoral Research Scientist to support post-doctoral training and help establish successful research scientists in their chosen field. During the fellowship tenure we are committed to provide mentorship for career development and improvement of communication skills. We also offer a highly attractive benefits package including competitive salary.

UKRI supports research in areas that include animal health, agriculture and food security, and bioscience for health which includes research on animals, genetic modification and stem cell research. Whilst you may not have direct involvement in this type of research, you should consider whether this conflicts with your personal values or beliefs.

Our mission

Want to make a difference in this world and work on something meaningful? At Chronomics we enable people to quantify how their environment and lifestyle is affecting their health to live healthier and happier lives… all from their DNA.

The role

We are looking for a knowledgeable and skilled researcher/engineer in machine learning who wants to make a difference and help bring about a proactive healthcare revolution. As a fast paced startup, we need someone with a can-do attitude who is happy to jump in and get their hands dirty. This might include anything from deriving novel health insights from our unique dataset, developing new modelling/algorithmic strategies and training novel models that will be included as part of our product, always with the end user in mind. This person will work at the interface of our front end and science teams, developing sophisticated biomarker and prediction algorithms that will not only have huge value for the research community but will also have lasting health benefits for people around the world.

Working in a startup with big ambitions, you will get the chance to access a unique-in-the-world biological dataset (longitudinal ‘omics’), collaborate with top academic experts, get your work published, have a say in how we drive the company forward and learn a ton along the way. An interest in understanding biology and disease is a must.

Essential skills:
BSc / MSc degree in a quantitative field (mathematics, statistics, physics, computer science, bioinformatics, …).
Good understanding of statistical / machine learning methods.
Programming skills in Python/R.
Hands-on experience in a research or commercial data science environment (4+ years).
Ability to pro-actively and independently develop new data-based insights and conclusions that are useful for the user.
Passion to develop a great product as part of a cross-functional and agile team.
Strong critical thinking, problem-solving, creativity and communication skills.
Great attention to detail.
Bias towards fast delivery while having high quality standards.
Resilience and ability to cope with multi-tasking.

Nice to have:
PhD in quantitative field.
Basic knowledge of biological concepts (genetics, epigenetics).
Hands-on experience in machine learning frameworks (scikit-learn, TensorFlow, …).
Previous experience in another health tech startup.
Previous experience with electronic health records (EHRs).
Knowledge of AWS.
A good track record of statistical / machine learning publications.

Location: Bristol, London, Cambridge or part remote
Start date: 1st Jan 2020 onwards
Company size: 10-20 people
Company type: VC funded

Benefits

Share options so early contributors benefit from our success.
Epigenetic test!!
Flexible office or home working.
Macbook pro
Friday pub sessions.

About Us

Chronomics is an ambitious health tech start-up that believes people should be in charge of their own health. Health management should be proactive, not reactive and it should be personalised. We are using longitudinal biological data to bring about this revolution. A revolution where not only will people be in control of their own future but also in control of how they contribute to the future of humanity through the use of their data.

This product is just the first step towards a platform technology that will serve as the interface between the biological and digital world. It's an incredibly exciting time to come on board where you can really make a difference. Find out more at www.chronomics.com

MSc or PhD in Computer Science, Mathematics or related technical discipline
Experience of research or innovative product development using natural language processing
Programming skills in commonly used ML languages (e.g. Python, R, Matlab)
Excellent depth and breadth of knowledge in modern machine learning
Excellent communication skills and the ability to work in a team
We are looking for someone who is excited to apply cutting-edge techniques from deep learning or natural language processing (NLP) to the text-to-speech (TTS) technology behind Alexa and our AWS cloud speech service.

As a Machine Learning Scientist you will be responsible for leading the development and launch of core product features. You will have significant influence on our overall strategy by helping define these product features, drive the system architecture, and spearhead the best practices that enable a quality product.

We believe that, like a human speaker, a text-to-speech system can produce more natural speech if it has an improved understanding of the meaning and context of the text. If you agree...

You will have the opportunity to solve hard problems with voice – we’ve spent years of invention on this. When we started working on this, the technology didn’t even exist – we had to invent it. Join us if you want to apply your deep learning skills in a dynamic field that is revolutionising the way people interact with devices and services.

We believe that voice will fundamentally improve the way people interact with technology. It can make the complex simple—it’s the most natural and convenient user interface. Voice is going to be a big part of our future and we are inventing it here.

RESPONSIBILITIES
Use your expertise in deep learning to research and implement novel approaches to make improvements to our text-to-speech technology.
Lead and Mentor junior engineers and scientists.
Participate in the design, development, evaluation, deployment and updating of data-driven models and analytical solutions for spoken language applications.
Experience working with large data sets

Job Title: Head of Data Science and Engineering
Job Description:
Location
South West
About the job
Summary
Are you an inspirational leader with exceptional technical capability?

As the Head of Data Science and Engineering you will be responsible for the technical delivery of the data science and data engineering work.

You will be responsible for delivering production systems involving data science and data engineering which will fundamentally change the capability of the UKHO. You will work with our developing internal capability as well as external companies and resource to deliver this transformational change.
Job description
The Head of Data Science and Engineering is a leadership role, so you will require the competencies and behaviours of an inspiring and confident leader, as well as having a strong grasp of mathematics and statistics as it is also a highly technical and scientific role.

The role will involve reviewing scientific papers in a variety of domains including but not limited to marine and geospatial. Through your own research and initiative and in collaboration with all members of the Data Science and Engineering Teams you will manage to work backlog and deliver plan – scheduling work, managing the costs and realising the benefits to the business.

You will line mange the Senior Delivery Manager (Data Science) and support their work, particularly with regards to technical delivery.

You will set the data science strategy for the organisation as well as leading the technical data science and data engineering work, and work with the local technical team leads to ensure delivery.

You will need to confidently engage with scientific organisations to build on-going strategic technical relationships with external bodies to support the aims of the organisation.

Responsibilities
To be successful in this role you will require exceptional leadership, technical and influencing skills, combined with the ability to lead change within a fast-moving agile programme.

In order to fulfil this role, you will need the following specific personal, technical and functional skills and experience:
Demonstrable and practical experience at a senior level in public or private sector of leading and delivering technical, scientific work through a team of highly skilled subject matter experts
Have a very good understanding of the fields of data science and data engineering, and demonstrable experience of implementing solutions to complex problems. Have at least 10 years’ practical experience of working in a data domain, such as:
a. Data modelling e.g. relational and dimensional
b. Business intelligence
c. Data engineering e.g ETL, querying SQL/ NoSQL databases
d. Geospatial analysis e.g. statistical analysis, KNN
e. Statistical analysis
Be capable of confidently programming in either one or more of the following: SQL, R, Python, Matlab, Scala, Java, and able to pick up other programming languages quickly.
Have a demonstrational background in teaching, coaching or mentoring with evidence of nurturing and developing talent.
Hold a master’s degree in Mathematics/Statistics or in a scientific or engineering discipline, preferably with a related PhD or significant practical experience of working with data preferably as a Data Scientist/Analyst.
Have experience of processing geospatial, marine or oceanographic data, or at least a proven record of being able to turn your hand to a variety of different data analysis tasks.
Have leading technical work and technical teams
Experience building technical functions at an organisation.
Have experience setting technical strategy within organisations
You will need:
To build and maintain strong collaborative contacts with the internal customer, subject/data experts as well as with other staff in customers’ and other areas of the UKHO.
To be a naturally inquisitive person who enjoys diving deep into material to find an answer to a yet unknown question.
To be confident and self-secure and be comfortable to deal with situations where there is a lot of unknown
An ability to work cooperatively with others
Exceptional communication and interpersonal skills
Behaviours
We'll assess you against these behaviours during the selection process:
Seeing the Big Picture
Changing and Improving
Communicating and Influencing
Developing Self and Others
Benefits
We offer a range of benefits to support your lifestyle, including generous leave allowances, flexible working hours, a lift-share scheme and regular training and development opportunities.

Working for UKHO, you could enjoy the following range of benefits: 26.5 annual leave, increasing after five years service.

Flexible working options include: Flexible working hours scheme, that includes up to two days per month Flexi leave, remote working, part-time working, job sharing, paid special leave, career breaks and unpaid leave.

We offer maternity, adoption and or shared parental leave of up to 26 weeks full pay, followed by 13 weeks statutory pay and a further 13 weeks unpaid leave; plus paternity leave of up to two weeks full pay, subject to certain qualifying criteria.

We also offer a brand new state of art awarding-winning building.
