Job Description:
Today Lonza is a global leader in life sciences. We are more than 15,000 employees in more than 100 locations around the world. While we work in science, theres no magic formula to how we do it. Our greatest scientific solution is talented people working together, devising ideas that help businesses to help people. In exchange, we let our people own their careers. Their ideas, big and small, genuinely improve the world. And thats the kind of work we want to be part of.

As an Associate Principal Scientist you will lead, direct and manage analytical comparability and characterisation work/study programs for pre-clinical and clinical phase biopharmaceutical products. Ensuring analytical studies meet the required quality standards, data has been correctly interpreted and the analytical methods used are fit for purpose.

Key responsibilities:
Leadership and management of multiple analytical programs to support pre clinical and clinical phase characterisation and comparability studies
Effective planning and performing of analytical work, preparation of study protocols and reports and review of analytical data ensuring scientific objectives and timelines are met
Preparation of GMP documentation e.g. SOPs and raise/complete regulatory records as required
Working as part of a multi-disciplinary scientific technical team for commercial and/or innovation projects as required, collaborating with scientists in other Lonza BU as applicable
Identify and drive departmental improvement projects
Ensuing studies performed meet the required quality standards
Maintaining a high level of scientific expertise and keeping up to date with current technical and regulatory expectations
Actively supports the training and coaching of junior scientists
Prepare and deliver training; both classroom sessions and practical demonstrations
Key requirements:
Degree in Chemistry, Biochemistry or Life Science
Familiarity with methods and instruments used for protein characterisation such as LC-MS (peptide mapping, intact mass analysis and oligosaccharide profiling), icIEF, CE-SDS, HPLC (SEC, RP, HIC, IEX, HILIC) and SEC-MALS
Expert appreciation of runnin g Mass Specs and how to use the data
Experience of Complex proteins Complex antibodies Complex Molecules
Understanding of protein structure, post translational modifications, degradation pathways for recombinant proteins
Understanding of phase appropriate regulatory and quality expectations for clinical phase analytical characterisation and comparability studies
Understanding of analytical control strategies applied to biopharmaceutical products
Putting together Packages of Work and Designing of Experiments
Every day, Lonzas products and services have a positive impact on millions of people. For us, this is not only a great privilege, but also a great responsibility. How we achieve our business results is just as important as the achievements themselves. At Lonza, we respect and protect our people and our environment. Any success we achieve is no success at all if not achieved ethically.

People come to Lonza for the challenge and creativity of solving complex problems and developing new ideas in life sciences. In return, we offer the satisfaction that comes with improving lives all around the world. The satisfaction that comes with making a meaningful difference.
Location: Slough, Berkshire, South East England, England

Job Title: Data Scientist - suit PhD - Sept/Oct start
Job Description:
Remote working possible c. 2-3 days per week. Company based London.

Have you just finished, or are about to complete your PhD? Are you looking to start your commercial career in Data Science? If so, this organisation has an opening that could be right for you, starting October 2020.

A research-driven Data Science company, they work with some of the biggest financial services and insurance names in the UK to help them solve the most complex issues posed within their business. They champion discovering new ways at looking at information, rather than doing things the way they have always been done.

You will be mentored by some of the best data science minds in the UK. Everyone in the organisation gets the opportunity to spend a good proportion of their time on self-development. The ethos in the business is that you can never stop learning and there may always be a better way of doing something or a new tool to try.

In the role, you will be designing, coding and implementing machine-learning and AI solutions, and there will always be a challenge. You will use your knowledge of linear and logisitic regression, variance and forecasting. It is likely that you will already have used tools such as R or Python during your studies (or SAS, SPSS, MATLAB), they are more interested in recruiting someone with a coding mindset who can apply this to any language.

If you have a Ph.D. with an education background in a highly numerate discipline (Maths, Applied Statistics, Computer Science, Physics or Engineering, or similar) and an interest in artificial intelligence and machine learning, please contact Ben Halfpenny at Talenting Career Science for more information on these roles.

147

Innovation Lab, Data Engineer (VP) We are looking for a Data Engineer with experience in developing data pipelines and join our team working on a new transaction monitoring application used across multiple businesses. As a Data Engineer in our team, you will be responsible for building data pipelines and integrate them with various internal or external systems. You will start by extracting the existing ETL layer from legacy R code to a robust, modern platform capable of serving multiple data models being developed. You will then look to scale this up to support multiple different data sources. You will work with the data scientists and business stakeholder as end consumers of the data to ensure we are meeting their requirements. You will contribute to the teams strategy around development and deployment best practices. This is an exciting opportunity to work on an important project, which will have huge impact on the business and our future architecture in this area. Key Responsibilities: Working closely with a data-centric application, hosting algorithms to detect possible market abuse. Designing the ETL architecture, as we look to extract it from an existing legacy application. After that, building out additional ETL layers to support the onboarding of additional data sources. Working closely with quants/data scientists to ensure that they have the data necessary to add new algorithms, and that the data is of the necessary quality and timeliness to support these. Act as the subject matter expert regarding data pipelines to the DevOps focused team and to external stakeholders Building a close relationship with clients and stakeholders to understand the use case for the platform, and prioritise work accordingly Skills & Qualifications: You have experience building data pipelines, ideally using Spark and Python/Scala. You understand how these should be hosted and how to take them into production in a supportable way. You have experience working with message queues (ideally Kafka or Solace), traditional databases (SQL) and NoSQL databases. You have worked closely with data scientists before, and may have experience creating pipelines that can serve ML/statistical algorithms. An ideal candidate would have experience working with R code. You have high development standards, especially for code quality, code reviews, unit testing, continuous integration and deployment You have proven capability to interact with clients and deliver results, taking ideas to production You have experience working in fast paced development environments You agree that verbal and written communication skills are vital ------------------------------------------------- Grade :All Job Level - All Job FunctionsAll Job Level - All Job Functions - GB ------------------------------------------------------ Time Type : ------------------------------------------------------ Citi is an equal opportunity and affirmative action employer. Altius is a leading data focused technology consultancy specialising in data, performance management and data science solutions. We’re leading the UK market in delivering Microsoft Azure based data platforms and our data science team is at the cutting edge of delivering machine and deep learning solutions. The business has an average annual growth of over 50% and employ 380 people across the UK, The Netherlands and India. Altius brings industry expertise in multiple industry sectors predominately for the retail, travel and transport, infrastructure, and public sectors.

In March 2020, Avanade, the leading digital innovator on the Microsoft ecosystem announced its acquisition of Altius. Combining Altius’ blend of in-depth technical knowledge and advanced architecture skills with Avanade’s breadth of offerings and its close partnership with Microsoft will enable clients to realise the true value of their business data. In addition, Altius’ expertise in enterprise performance management is a valuable addition to Avanade’s technology capabilities.

We’re a dynamic group of bright and talented people who are passionate about their work and offer clients the best thinking through a collaborative culture that honours diversity and reflects the communities in which we operate. This is a fantastic opportunity to operate at the forefront of technology and once the business has transitioned to Avanade, work on a global platform with 29,000 digitally connected people across 23 countries.

More details on Altius and Avanade can be found on https://www.altiusdata.com and https://www.avanade.com

Job Description

The Principal Advisory Consultant in Data Science provides expertise on data science and artificial intelligence to a variety of corporate clients across multiple industry verticals. You will work closely with your clients to envision, build and productionise complex products that operate at the intersection of technology, data and artificial intelligence.

There are two primary responsibilities in this role; to design data science solutions addressing the challenges that our clients face and leading the build of those solutions, and to advise our clients in strategies, operating models and other aspects to enable them to modernise their business using the latest tools and techniques. You will bring together cross-functional teams that include advisors, industry experts, developers, designers, and data scientists, with the sole purpose of delivering transformational results for your clients.

This role requires exceptional consulting skills as you will engage with executives through to operational roles to help understand and define business problems, design solutions and roadmaps, and manage the process from inception to successful implementation.

Responsibilities Include:
Solving key business problems and challenges by framing the problem, developing a vision and building a roadmap to deliver.
Managing the full lifecycle of complex analytics projects from pre-sales and bid support through to discovery, estimation, development, testing, deployment and transition to operational support.
Involvement in every step of our client’s journey; identifying the problem, defining and delivering the solution, while building a strong relationship with our clients. This includes gathering and analysing information, formulating and testing hypotheses alongside technical experts.
Working with clients to understand, define and quantify the benefits and opportunities of better leveraging their data and technologies.
Forming partnerships with highly skilled analytical and technical resources, both onshore and offshore, and working closely to deliver the scope of the project.
Participate in pre-sales activities to demonstrate how data science and statistics may be applied for commercial advantage of potential clients.
Understanding technical concepts and being able to explain them to business stakeholders.
Becoming a trusted advisor by building long-term relationships with clients, working with them on developing long-term strategies around data and technology and helping bring them to fruition.
Developing industry specific Intellectual Property to support cross-platform consulting solutions.
Supporting business development through the generation of bid response documentation, business cases and ideas to support the clients’ information management strategy.
Experience Profile

You will be an experienced leader in analytics, coupled with an exceptional personal drive and ambition to progress your career.
Significant experience in the design and build of data science solutions for customers.
Hands-on experience in data science, data analytics, BI, data warehousing, data platform development or other relevant hands on technical experience.
Exposure to delivering cloud-based solutions, preferably Microsoft Azure.
Experience in holding commercial conversations with internal and external stakeholders.
Experience in the management of risks, issues and dependencies.
Excellent communication skills with experience including stakeholder management, commercial negotiation, business writing and delivery of presentations.
Understanding of structured and unstructured data analysis, streaming data, IoT, artificial intelligence, natural language processing and related topical analytics fields.
Able to manage teams across multiple projects.
Confident in engaging at CxO level.
Be able to actively engage and lead sales and business development opportunities with clients.
Knowledge of machine learning algorithms and/or query development is beneficial.
Strong business analysis skills and deep understanding of analytics.
Background experience in an analytics discipline such as machine learning, artificial intelligence or statistical algorithm
Full life-cycle delivery experience, from initial opportunity through to requirement development, estimation, solution design and implementation
Additional Information

Applications are only invited from candidates with the right to reside and work within the UK. Candidates should be willing to travel for the purposes of client delivery and collaborating with colleagues.

Job Title: Senior Analytical Development Scientist - Cleaning Validation
Job Description:
Are you an experienced Senior Analyst with equipment cleaning verification experience in a GMP environment? A brand-new opportunity has arisen within a Leicestershire based global organisation. Due to continued expansion at the site they are seeking a Senior Analyst to carry out analytical work related to cleaning verification of production equipment according to GMP standards.

Company
You will join an exciting and innovative business whose mission is to provide services across the drug development lifecycle to the pharmaceutical and biotech sectors.

Role Responsibility
You will be responsible for developing and validating/transferring analytical cleaning methods for the cleanliness verification of production equipment while carrying out cleaning assessment to GMP standards. The role will require you to liaise with the Operations team (manufacturing, development) to arrange cleanliness verification with minimal impact to production operations. You need to maintain records of all cleaning assessments carried out and review analytical documentation as well as report and investigate incidents of cleaning verification failures. You will use your excellent communication skills to delegate and monitor the progress of work on a daily basis and update the senior staff at the department on the progress of work. You will also compile GMP documents such as analytical methods, SOP’s, and protocols.

Experience

BSc (or equivalent) in Chemistry or a Life Science subject with a significant chemistry component
Significant experience of working in a GMP drug product development laboratory
Significant experience of developing/validating HPLC method and thorough understanding HPLC theory
Significant experience of supporting pharmaceutical equipment cleaning verification
Experience in the use of TOC for equipment cleanliness assessment
Experience in supervising staff or line management (advantageous)
Experience of using Empower chromatography data capture system (advantageous)
Experience in the use of LC-MS systems (advantageous)
Experience in supporting Equipment cleaning validation (advantageous) Full details, including and comprehensive job description, will be provided on application
Apply Now!

Job Description:
We are currently looking for a Mass Spectrometry Proteomic Principal Scientist with extensive hand on experience of LC-MS/MS to join and innovative Biotechnology company based in the North West of the UK. As the Mass Spectrometry Proteomic Principal Scientist you will provide expert technical knowledge and run a range of LC-MS focused diagnostic experiments to support the discovery of predictive Biomarkers.

This position would suit an experienced Scientist with hands on knowledge of designing, developing and executing protein Biomarker and Cell Signalling studies using LC-MS ( Liquid Chromatography Mass Spectrometry ).

KEY DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES:

Your duties as the Mass Spectrometry Proteomic Principal Scientist will be varied however the key duties and responsibilities are as follows:
Establish an LC-MS platform, including library creation, for the discovery of Proteomic Biomarkers.
Develop and validate Mass Spectrometry assays for the discovery and assessment of Biological compounds, using your knowledge of Proteins and Protein-Drug interactions to positively benefit diagnostic and predictive projects .
You will troubleshoot, optimise and implement new processes for LC-MS assays for pre-clinical and clinical stage studies.
You will collaborate closely with a range of groups across to business to support Biomarker discovery through LC-MS assays. You will also work closely with statisticians and data scientists to analyse data generated.
ROLE REQUIREMENTS:

To be successful in your application to this exciting opportunity as the Mass Spectrometry Proteomic Principal Scientist we are looking to identify the following on your profile and past history:
Relevant degree in a Life Sciences discipline, ideally with a Biological focus (e.g. Biology, Biopharmaceuticals, -omics studies) in addition to significant experience of designing and executing LC-MS studies to identify proteins Biomarkers and/or cell signalling pathways .
Proven experience of developing LC-MS assays including a strong analytical background of Mass Spectrometry applications for Proteomic analysis. You will also ideally have experience of analysing large scale omics-based datasets.
A working knowledge and practical experience with method development, troubleshooting and analysis of MS / LC-MS techniques including experience of related software (Spotfire, MATLAB, R, JMP etc.)
Key Words: Biomarker | Diagnostic | Biologics | Mammalian Cell Culture | LC-MS | LCMS | LC MS | Liquid chromatography mass spectrometry | Proteomics | Proteins | Cell Culture | Tissue Culture | Cell Signalling | Analytical | Process Development

Hyper Recruitment Solutions Ltd (HRS) is an Equal Opportunities employer who are certified by Investors in People for talent development. We therefore welcome applications for any interested parties who fulfil the role requirements for this position. HRS is a company exclusively supporting the science and technology sectors, and is made up of a collaboration of recruitment professionals and scientists. We look forward to helping you with your next career moves

Today Lonza is a global leader in life sciences. We are more than 15,000 employees in more than 100 locations around the world. While we work in science, there’s no magic formula to how we do it. Our greatest scientific solution is talented people working together, devising ideas that help businesses to help people. In exchange, we let our people own their careers. Their ideas, big and small, genuinely improve the world. And that’s the kind of work we want to be part of.

Due to significant growth and expansion of Lonza’s Slough manufacturing operations and Lonza’s global centre of excellence in process development, we are looking to recruit a Senior Principal Scientist to join the Manufacturing, Science and Technology (MSAT) organization in order to lead the technical transfer of multiple concurrent complex manufacturing processes (either USP and/or DSP) using a defined structured approach and expertise between Process Development, through pilot stage accountable for the technical oversight and monitoring ensuring a robust and technically capable GMP manufacturing process.

The Senior Principal Scientist will be a recognized process expert in area of expertise and will provide detailed technical support via multiple customer facing project teams to deliver existing but also novel technology advancement, perform complex technical data analysis and deliver the required complex technical process documentation in collaboration, negotiation and discussion with external customers, team SME’s and internal stakeholders as required.

This role will have an established internal network and have influence and credibility across operations in area of expertise and with MSAT team management.

Key responsibilities:
To represent MSAT within within multiple complex customer facing product project teams using a standard methodology/procedure to successfully transfer both existing as well as evaluate new technologies either into USP and/or DSP cGMP biologics manufacturing from development through MSAT pilot scale facilities.
To be accountable for the introduction and support of qualification of new process technologies into cGMP manufacturing, whilst managing technical risks associated with process transfer, leading cross functional teams to ensure relevant transfer and communication of critical process and technical information such that successful outcomes are achieved as agreed with customer.
To pro-actively communicate effectively negotiate, collaborate and demonstrate technical influence over the customer, via both face to face meeting and telecoms driving problem resolution and offer successful technical outcomes
To be accountable for independent on plant technical support, process monitoring and complex data analysis using experience to anticipate issues before they become critical.
To lead associated improvement activities leading cross functional teams to successfully implement according to customer and business needs.
To use technical influence and knowledge in project teams to ensure delivery of project timelines according to customer needs
To proactively anticipate, evaluate and resolve technical challenges within area of expertise
To be self-managed in resolving gaps in unit operations through batch reviews and applied continual process learning/knowledge capture.
To be aware of external biopharmaceutical manufacturing technology advancements, understand and introduce new technologies and how they may be applicable to process innovation, cost or yield improvement.
To act as coach/mentor to other team members and also cross functionally and SME and share knowledge in certain aspects of process operations

Key requirements:
MSc/PhD in science related disciplines
Mammalian and/or microbial background for drug substance processing
Extensive experience in a drug substance environment
Strong knowledge in laboratory development and/or a manufacturing operations background.
Be a recognized expert in field USP and/or DSP drug substance operations from working in a cGMP environment.
Have a successful technical transfer expertise gained from a drug substance manufacturing environment.
Have demonstrable experience working in cross functional project management and technical transfer activities with ability to multi task, prioritize and be an effective decision maker.
Have a deep understanding of manufacturing process as a whole e.g. Supply chain, analytical, QA.
Strong interpersonal skills are required with ability to work cross functionally with internal and external customers.

People come to Lonza for the challenge and creativity of solving complex problems and developing new ideas in life sciences. In return, we offer the satisfaction that comes with improving lives all around the world. The satisfaction that comes with making a meaningful difference .
Location: Slough, Berkshire, South East England, England

Job Description:
The Role

The Imaging Solutions team is central to the development of Perspectum’s imaging services, both for clinical diagnostic and pharmaceutical customers. This team Provides strategic Imaging solutions for our imaging methods and devices, as well as new project designs (Research/ Clinical/ Pharma), and imaging quality assurance in new and existing offerings.

Duties & Responsibilities
Ensure Imaging problems are seen through to solution, including process, guidance and product updates.
Support Product Development and Research, including
Standardising new offerings across supported platforms
Ensure the protocols support our full range of scanners, including new models
Collaborate with project managers and innovation scientists for imaging protocol design.
Plan product performance testing both in vitro and in vivo and lead the imaging acquisitions for it.
Design, lead, and perform phantom analysis for product developments
Design, implement and maintain the necessary tools for imaging site and product performance quality assurance such as:
Design and maintenance of quality control process
Design, order and validation of product phantoms
Provide regular scientific reports on scanner performance
Implement/maintain software tools such as phantom data base
Provide continuous technical quality checks on all site activations performed by Imaging Services, including audit implementation of imaging protocols across different imaging sites. Document, follow-up and salvage incoherent imaging protocols.
Provide the necessary tools, documentation, information and training to service teams for new projects/studies including acquisition manuals and protocol definitions.
Ensure the company has the tools and robust support systems to maximize the number of supported scanners and imaging sites along with capturing the knowledge gained during activations.
Drive innovation and improvement in imaging service processes

Knowledge & Requirements: Essential
Educated to at least degree level in a relevant health science, life science or engineering discipline.
Deep understanding of MRI
Research and development experience in MRI
Ability to perform scans on at least one of the three main MRI manufacturers: GE, Philips or Siemens.
Fluent in a coding language, preferably MATLAB
Excellent communication and networking skills, attention to detail, and the ability to excel in a fast-moving environment.
Experience in scientific documentation and writing.

Knowledge & Requirements: Desired
PhD in MRI field with experience of applying clinical MRI
Deep research experience with at least one of the three main MRI manufacturers, including research in abdominal MRI (acquisition and/or postprocessing), preferably in several application areas
Experience in developing sequences, methods, or postprocessing in MRI
Understanding of current trends, developments, and products in MRI
Experience with MR phantoms
Familiar with workflow set up and process optimisation

Bumble is expanding its analytical function again. We are looking for experienced analysts to be part of an established team. Job Title: Senior Data Scientist (Business Intelligence and Analytics)
Job Description:
Ordnance Survey (OS) is the national mapping agency for Great Britain, and a world-leading geospatial data and technology organisation. Serving government, business and citizens across Britain and the world, OS helps customers in virtually all sectors improve quality of life and we’re looking for people to join our journey…

Senior Data Scientist (Business Intelligence and Analytics)

As a country and globally, we’re all experiencing challenging times right now, but Ordnance Survey (OS) continue to support the nation with our accurate geospatial data and services. As an organisation we are embarking on an ambitious growth strategy in location data, insight and services. Innovating our products, services and technology to benefit our customers, businesses and people across Great Britain and globally. In order to do this, we want to continue adding new skills and capabilities to our business and even in these tough times, we’re able to use technology to recruit talent to OS.

About Us

Ordnance Survey Limited (OS) is the national mapping agency for Great Britain, and a world-leading geospatial data and technology organisation. As a reliable partner to government, business and citizens across Britain and the world, OS helps its customers in virtually all sectors improve quality of life. OS expertise and data supports efficient public services and infrastructure, new technologies in transport and communications, national security and emergency services and exploring the great outdoors.

Imagine working for an organisation which has been innovating and pushing boundaries for over two centuries – and continues to do so today. A company full of unique expertise and skill, with a host of exciting and innovative opportunities to pursue. A business which is making a real difference to lives, communities and businesses everywhere. Ordnance Survey provides world-renowned data and services which underpin critical activities across government and the commercial sector, while continually expanding its horizons both internationally and into the future.

About the Role

This is an opportunity for a Senior Data Scientist to oversee our Business Intelligence & Analytics activities within our Data Science & Analytics team at Ordnance Survey - to provide data science expertise and leadership across a variety of data science projects.

In this role, you will use your skills and experience to extract new insights, information and evidence from Ordnance Survey’s internal business databases using a full range of techniques, from traditional coding and data processing, to cutting-edge machine learning algorithms and predictive analytics – all approached with an expert scientific mindset. You will also be familiar with cloud-based and distributed analytics environments such as Apache Spark and Databricks and will understand the types of business intelligence that can be gained from successful exploitation of business data, and how it can be used effectively to underpin decision making.

You will be highly customer focused, always considering the business problem in everything you do and working as closely with stakeholders as possible at every stage. You will provide expert advice in applying analysis, analytics, data-mining techniques and data modelling to optimise decisions across the business, and will provide thought-leadership, consultancy and technical expertise to both internal and external clients in data analytics and implementation.

You will also be a natural innovator – always seeking to try out new ideas, and you will regularly undertake rapid proof of concept work for new and innovative propositions involving data. We’ll be looking to our senior data scientists as a rich source of new ideas and inventions – some of which will grow to deliver new products or services for Ordnance Survey.

Finally, you will be a good communicator, with a natural aptitude for collaborating with others to deliver results. Business Intelligence is not a mature function at Ordnance Survey, and your role will include demonstrating the art of the possible, liaising with stakeholders to identify and access sources of data around the business, and working with decision makers to identify the key business questions that require answers and provide data-driven evidence to support business decisions and new proposition development.

About You

You will be able to demonstrate evidence against these key criteria;

Degree level qualification in a quantitative discipline or significant experience in a relevant field
Prior experience in a data science role
Expert in working with data and a passion for solving problems with all kinds of data
Track record of working with customers and stakeholders to solve business problems using data
Strong database and programming skills (including at least one of: Python, Scala, R)
Track record in the application of machine learning and big data technologies
Positive and collaborative work ethic
Excellent ability to communicate and present complex subject matter in an accessible manner
Excellent and confident engagement, presentation and communication skills

In addition, the following are desirable (but not essential) criteria for the role:

E xperience of managing people
Experience of using predictive or descriptive analytics to inform better business decision-making and/or automating business processes or customer experiences
Experience in creating dashboards or other data visualisations for business intelligence
Track record in demonstrating business value through applying data science to business problems
Expertise in working with geospatial data

About the Rewards

We want you to love what you do. That’s why our benefits package rewards a job well done. We’ll give you:

Salary – £52,700 - £58,900
Performance related bonus
Competitive pension
37 hour working week
25 days annual leave - (30 days after five years) bank holidays and an extra 3 over Christmas
Training and development – We offer in-house training, a variety of masterclasses, bespoke training, study leave, access to learning resources and professional membership subscriptions
A wide range of additional benefits including free parking, paid volunteer day, support with health and wellbeing, sports and social activities, staff discount on over 500 national stores and more

Location:
This role will be based at our HQ in Southampton

Closing date - July 12th 2020

About Us

Ordnance Survey is committed to making inclusion an everyday reality and promoting a diverse workforce. Each individual at OS brings their own perspectives, work experiences, lifestyles, and cultures with them, and we believe that a more diverse team builds more innovative products, provides a better service to our customers, and helps us all grow and learn as individuals.

Check out our careers video below and hear from OS employees about what life is like to work here!

In light of the recent communication from the World Health Organisation declaring COVID-19 as a pandemic, if you have been in known contact with anyone with the Coronavirus, are recovering from the virus or have relatable symptoms we ask you to notify the OS Resourcing team at careers@os.uk immediately prior to attendance of your interview to discuss alternate options during the recruitment process.

If you have any questions or queries please contact careers@os.co.uk.

Bachelors degree in Computer Science, Engineering, Statistics, Mathematics or related field
Experience working with AWS big data technologies (Redshift, S3, EMR, Python and Spark) and ML tools
Background in supporting data scientists in conducting large scale data analyses / modelling to support business decision making
Familiarity with statistical models and data mining algorithms
Knowledge of software engineering best practices across the development lifecycle, including agile methodologies, coding standards, code reviews, source management, build processes, testing, and operations
Advanced skills in Excel as well as any data visualization tools like Tableau/QuickSight or similar BI tools (familiarity with Tableau preferred).
Be self-driven, and show ability to deliver on ambiguous projects with incomplete or dirty data.
An ability and interest in working in a fast-paced and rapidly-changing environment
Strong verbal/written communication and data presentation skills, including an ability to effectively communicate with both business and technical teams
At Amazon Advertising, we are dedicated to drive measurable outcomes for brand advertisers, agencies, authors, and entrepreneurs. Our ad solutions—including sponsored, display, video, and custom ads—leverage Amazon’s innovations and insights to find, attract, and engage intended audiences throughout their daily journeys. With a range of flexible pricing and buying models, including self-service, managed service, and programmatic ad buying, these solutions help businesses build brand awareness, increase product sales, and more.

We are hiring a Data Engineer (DE) to help us deliver on a key global goal of setting up an ML-based, real time service that will help segment our customers and continuously feed recommendations to both global Ads and Consumer teams to improve customer success.

The person hired will help build the data-sets to underpin the ML models as well as help create the output pipeline. S/he will be working very closely with a data science team and a scale Data Engineering team. The ideal candidate will be passionate about working with big data sets and have the expertise to utilize these data-sets to answer business questions and drive growth. This is a highly visible role with global scope, VP/SVP level exposure, international stakeholder management and some international travel. The role is based in Central London.

The primary responsibilities of this role include:
Design, develop and maintain scalable, automated, derived / or non-derived, insightful data-marts and tables which will be the main input for the models, reports and dashboards
Use analytical and statistical rigor to solve complex problems and drive business decisions.
Write high integrity code to retrieve and analyze data from database tables (Redshift), learn and understand a broad range of Amazon’s data resources and know how, when, and which to use and which not to use
Explore new datasets, onboard them into our data cluster and scale for WW use
Set up ingest, analyse, output processes
Set up mechanisms to proactively measure quality of outputs
Create and maintain key program reports
Master’s degree in Computer Science, Engineering, Statistics, Mathematics or related field
Expert in writing and tuning SQL scripts
Experience working in very large data warehouse environments
Experience in a technology or advertising tech company
Experience conducting large scale data analysis to support business decision making

About us

Launched in 2012, Checkout.com is a leading international provider of online payment solutions. Checkout.com is built on 100% proprietary technology and handles every part of the payment process, providing complete transparency across the entire payment value chain.

We currently process 150+ currencies and offer access to all international cards and popular local payment methods to merchants through one integration.

Customers in our portfolio include international businesses like Samsung, Transferwise, Hopper, Virgin and Adidas. Our mission is to partner with smart businesses to optimise their payments, increase revenue and meet the dynamic needs of their customers.

We are building a unique work environment where our people aspire to solve complex problems and deliver valuable solutions. We believe that excellence can be achieved through a dynamic culture driven by collaboration and teamwork.

In May 2020, we completed a $150m Series B funding round, tripling our valuation to $5.5bn.

About the role

Checkout.com is actively looking for a talented Senior DevOps engineer who will participate in the planning, design, development, deployment and maintenance of a set of big data and data-pipeline initiatives within our AWS Cloud environment.

You will be working alongside a number of talented Data Engineers, DevOps engineers, and Data Scientists working within the AWS Cloud. Your primary responsibilities will be ensuring our data platform is:

- Architected in such a way that it meets requirements from a business and technical perspective (scalability, availability, etc)
- Described as code (IaC), with a strong focus on infrastructure/code reusability
- Well documented, facilitating not only adoption by users/consumers, but also contributions by other Data Engineering/DevOps members of the team
Joining a high-growth global FinTech Company and collaborating with various enthusiastic and excellence-driven Engineers, you will gain exposure to a fast-scaling Cloud environment where you will be able to learn while making a real impact.
Key Responsibilities
Collaborate with passionate technologists across multiple disciplines to ensure security, resiliency and performance requirements
Take part in the evolution of the infrastructure and development of the infrastructure code base
Create scripts and pipelines to automate routine tasks
About You
5+ years of experience administering Linux servers 2+ year experience in AWS (AWS Certification desirable)
2+ year experience with infrastructure as code such as Terraform
Experience managing batch and streaming data related infrastructure as code. We use Kinesis/Kafka, SQS, SNS, Snowflake, Airflow, dbt, and S3 but we would consider your experience using similar tech
Experience with configuration management tools such as Ansible
Experience with scripting - E.g. Python, bash , Perl
Experience with CI / CD pipelines such as Jenkins or Teamcity
2+ year experience with Docker / ECS / Kubernetes
Experience with Git
Good knowledge of network infrastructure design & public cloud architecture
Self-motivated, able to deliver consistent results through problem solving
Autonomous, able to manage multiple projects simultaneously with minimal guidance
Fluent in English
We are always looking for great people so if you don’t see a role here that fits you but you want to work with us, please send us your CV and a cover letter explaining the kind of role you are searching for and we will contact you.

We make recruiting decisions based on your experience, skills and personality. We welcome applications from all members of society irrespective of age, sex, disability, sexual orientation, race, religion or belief. If you have not been contacted within 3 weeks please deem your application as unsuccessful.

We are committed to protecting and respecting your privacy. Ph.D. degree in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, Machine Learning, or related field
Typically requires 10+ years of relevant work experience
Excellent publication record of ML and NLP at major conferences that shows breadth and depth
Recognized as a leader in area of specialty (machine learning, Natural Language Processing, etc.)
Proven track record of mentoring and developing other researchers
Strongly desirable to be proficient in more than one more major programming languages (C++, Java, C#, C, , Perl/Ruby, etc.)
Expert in some mathematical programming libraries (such as R, Weka, Matlab, SAS)
Expert knowledge in model evaluation and performance, operationalization and scalability of scientific techniques and establishing decision strategies.
Within Amazon Alexa, the Alexa Knowledge team combines developing natural language processing and machine techniques and applying them across large volumes of data. To understand what users are asking, which data sources contain knowledge to improve Alexa answers, extracting that knowledge and formulating the right response. We build autonomous systems at scale and are part of a huge research and engineering effort on the Amazon Alexa team.

We’ve solved many complex problems to get to where we are today, but there are still plenty of challenges ahead of us, and Alexa is getting smarter every day. The problems we solve in the Alexa Knowledge team in Cambridge help Alexa get smarter by understanding the different ways people talk, by learning more and more facts about the world, by improving her common sense reasoning and by responding in the most natural way possible in multiple languages.

We set out to build Alexa at Amazon because we believe that voice will fundamentally improve the way people will interact with technology, and are breaking boundaries by allowing users to access information and services today through voice, with many more exciting projects in the pipeline.

In the Knowledge Extraction and Understanding group, we are constantly making Alexa smarter by enabling her to learn about what’s going on in the world. We use multiple Machine Learning and NLP techniques to enable learning and reasoning across a range of structured and unstructured data. We are constantly at the forefront of both research and engineering in understanding user demands and data sources, to extract the right knowledge, expand the range of and how Alexa accesses information– all to improve Alexa and give users the best experience. The scope of the teams in the Knowledge Extraction and Understanding group is broad, covering a diverse range of problem spaces that include, but are not limited to semantic understanding, structured data extraction, fact extraction and verification from unstructured text, natural language generation, machine translation, model adaptation, large-scale categorisation and ranking. What’s more, we do it at scale, to bring all those solutions to millions of customers that use Alexa every day.
We develop technology that combines natural language understanding, acquiring large volumes of structured knowledge, and machine reasoning to allow our customers to get answers to their questions in the most natural way possible. We play a key role in the development of Alexa; Amazon’s cloud based voice service which delights customers on products such as Echo and Fire TV.

We’re looking for a Principal Applied Scientist to join our rapidly expanding group in Cambridge, England to help us achieve those goals. The ideal candidate is clearly passionate about new opportunities and has a demonstrable track record of success. A keen sense of ownership, effective teamwork and strong communication skills are absolute requirements. We are looking for leaders in the field. As a successful Principal Applied Scientist in the group you will mentor a group of scientists, ranging from post-doc level up to very senior scientists. You’ll utilise a range of methods across the NLP and ML domains, help drive innovation through publications at leading conferences, and bring step-changes to a range of products through impactful results. You will be challenged by a strong team and get to work across areas spanning across the spaces of text analytics, semantics, deep neural networks, machine translation, natural language generation, search, ranking and many other areas that are key to enriching the Alexa experience. All problems are large scale, and require new approaches to achieve our ambitious goals.
Industry experience showing research results being deployed at scales
Experience building and delivering models for complex systems that leverage our technology platform and work well with other company systems
Specific leadership in Question-Answering, Unstructured Text Extraction and/or Natural Language Generation

Today Lonza is a global leader in life sciences. We are more than 15,000 employees in more than 100 locations around the world. While we work in science, there’s no magic formula to how we do it. Our greatest scientific solution is talented people working together, devising ideas that help businesses to help people. In exchange, we let our people own their careers. Their ideas, big and small, genuinely improve the world. And that’s the kind of work we want to be part of.

We are currently looking to recruit a Scientist to join our Purification Development team based in Slough. As a Scientist, you will be responsible for developing / evaluating, characterising and validating protein purification processes for monoclonal antibodies and other recombinant proteins and support the transfer of these processes to pilot and GMP Manufacturing scale.

If you have previous AKTA or Chromatography experience, please read on!

Key responsibilities:
Plan and design own experiments with guidance from lead scientist
Buffer preparation, purification of proteins
Responsible for the execution and delivery of own projects with particular attention to safety, quality, on time and right first time
Escalate technical issues in a timely fashion
Ensure that experimental details, raw data and results are recorded as appropriately
Collate, analyse and evaluate data to produce good quality process information
Operate as part of a cross-functional project team
Prepare and deliver high quality presentations, protocols and reports
Ensure own training is up to date
Contribute to the efficient running of the laboratories

Key requirements:
BSc / PhD in Biotechnology or in a relevant scientific discipline and appropriate laboratory experience
Theoretical knowledge of protein chemistry and protein purification
Strong practical laboratory skills within this area
Practical experience with laboratory scale AKTA chromatography and ultrafiltration (TFF) systems
Strong written and verbal communication skills
Strong planning and organisational skills
Proficient in the use of Unicorn software
Must have excellent interpersonal skills to work effectively as part of a multidisciplinary/project team
Comfortable working in a fast-paced environment with changing priorities

Every day, Lonza’s products and services have a positive impact on millions of people. For us, this is not only a great privilege, but also a great responsibility. How we achieve our business results is just as important as the achievements themselves. At Lonza, we respect and protect our people and our environment. Any success we achieve is no success at all if not achieved ethically.

People come to Lonza for the challenge and creativity of solving complex problems and developing new ideas in life sciences. In return, we offer the satisfaction that comes with improving lives all around the world. The satisfaction that comes with making a meaningful difference.

Job Description:
The International Pricing & Analytics Team

Pricing and risk analysis, core functions in finance and insurance, have always been among Admiral’s key strengths. As these industries are rapidly evolving in the context of disruptive technologies and new business models, we keep looking for innovative ways to stay ahead of the curve!

The International Pricing & Analytics Team are 20+ people based in Cardiff (UK), who provide strategic advice and support to all countries in the Admiral Group. We evaluate hundreds of variables from internal and external data sources to tailor the price of our products for each of our customers. Our Analytics function leverages new machine learning techniques to augment our traditional Pricing expertise. We travel to our overseas operations in Spain, Italy, France, and the USA to help launch new products, implement the latest technologies, and research new data sources.

About the Role

As a Data Engineer, you will be responsible for the acquisition of data from multiple sources to feed Machine Learning (ML) models deployed in the cloud. Your expertise will be key to advance and automate this main area of the ML lifecycle. You will have the chance to define our best practices for data engineering, as well as choose and implement the latest tools, technologies, and approaches.

You will have the opportunity to work with diverse stakeholders at different levels of the organisation such as data warehouse managers, cloud engineers, data scientists, pricing experts and senior business managers, both in the UK and abroad. Depending on project needs, you might need to travel occasionally to our international businesses.

Your Responsibilities

Build, operate, automate, and monitor data processing systems

Define data engineering best practices and advise other divisions on them

Research new ideas and stay up to date with industry developments

Make recommendations on how to improve existing architectures and processes

Communicate results to key decision-makers across geographies

Essential Skills and Experience

Work experience building data acquisition pipelines

Hands-on experience using cloud data tools (e.g. Redshift, S3, Data Pipeline)

Experience using data warehouse tools such as Teradata and BigQuery

Ability to code/script in a language such as SQL or Python

Understanding of version control systems such as Git

Nice to Have

Experience using dataflow/stream processing tools such as Apache NiFi and Kafka

Knowledge of Linux and comfortable using the command line

Experience using data manipulation libraries such as Pandas

Knowledge of RDBMS such as Postgres and Oracle

AWS Big Data and/or Machine Learning certifications

About Admiral

Job Description:
The Bank of England is the UK's central bank. Our mission is to deliver monetary and financial stability for the British people. The Bank of England is a diverse organisation. Each of its 4,000 plus people are committed to public service and dedicated to promoting the good of the people of the United Kingdom by maintaining monetary and financial stability.

Department Overview

The Bank’s mission depends on data and analytics, through their role in the Bank's decisions, its operations, and the information it provides to the public.

Data and analytics have received a new level of senior attention and backing in the Bank, following Huw van Steenis' Future of Finance review, the Bank's response, and the Governor's Mansion House speech. The Bank is now publicly committed to delivering a "world class regtech and data strategy". A new Directorate, Data and Analytics Transformation (DAT), has been created to lead on this. DAT is the Bank’s centre of expertise for data strategy implementation and the compilation, dissemination and publication of regulatory and statistical data. We support analysis, policy and decision making by the Bank’s Committees, UK government departments and international organisations. Key stakeholders for our work include MPC, FPC and PRA Boards and our data are used in the Inflation Report, Financial Stability Report, Credit Conditions Review, Stress Test Results, FPC Core Indicators and Quarterly Bulletin. Decisions made in these Boards and from these reports have national economic significance.

Within DAT, a new division called Data Strategy Implementation Division (DSID) leads the definition and implementation of the Bank's data and analytics strategy. This strategy touches on practically all functions of the Bank, due to the central importance of data and analysis in our daily work. It also affects the firms from whom we collect data under statutory powers, the domestic and international official sector bodies with whom we share our data and analytics, and the public who receive data and analytics outputs published by the Bank.

Through the 2020s we intend to transform the way the Bank defines and collects data, the way it manages data and its capacity to analyse data, to make our use of data and analytics as insightful, reliable and efficient as possible. In addition, DSID leads the operation of the shared data and analytics services that mean colleagues can harness the power of data and analytics in their BAU work today.

Role Description

Reliable and well managed data is critical to the Bank in order to achieve its overall strategy. This new position provides the opportunity to be part of the team that will define, shape and implement the Bank’s Data Management policies and processes. The purpose of this role is data enablement through empowering projects and business areas with the support and tools they need to leverage their data in order to achieve their objectives. Underpinning this is a foundation of best practice Data Management including Data Governance.

The successful candidate will work closely with colleagues across all areas of the Bank. They will seek to gain an understanding of each business area and their data-related objectives. This will help them position realistic ideas to address data-related problems and articulate the value of Data Management principles relative to their operations, priorities and constraints. The ideal engagement output would include a fully sponsored plan of action, with clearly defined objectives, roles and timelines. They will achieve buy-in of their ideas through demonstrating subject matter expertise which establishes credibility, and through the alignment of goals and deliverables.

With the aptitude to be actively involved in project work, as well as change initiatives in BAU areas, the successful candidate will be comfortable influencing data considerations at the planning stages as well as helping to implement at execution stage. They will provide consultative guidance on all things data and be seen as a thought-leader whilst providing realistic ideas and continuously looking for operational improvements.

The successful candidate will be proactive and self-sufficient, and will be entrusted with the freedom shape their own working agenda. In return there will be an expectation to demonstrate positive stakeholder engagement that results in value-adding progress and the adoption best practice Data Management, or the utilisation of existing services such as Master Data Management, Data Registration (data cataloguing), Data Governance Advisory, Metadata Management and Data Quality. Whilst given some freedom to evolve their own role, they will also define and create new data enablement capabilities.

The candidate will need to develop deep working relationships with key stakeholders such as Technology (all teams within), Projects and Programmes, Corporate Portfolio office, HR, the PRA, Bankwide Risk and Compliance. Effective working relationships built on trust, mutual good intent and win-win outcomes will need to be developed, oftentimes resulting in intensive collaboration.

In parallel with the regular ongoing data enablement work, there will be an expectation for the candidate to contribute to the Bank’s new data strategy by working with their line manager to shape and implement activities that enable data users to find, access, share and trust data more effectively.

Although initially there are currently no formal line management expectations, the mentoring of junior DAT team members is expected. There will be line management responsibilities to follow in line with the success of the role, and scale of the workload. This arrangement is subject to change at any time depending on business needs.

To summarise, the role will primarily involve:
Data enablement through consultancy grade advice, guidance and support on projects and change initiatives.
Proactively raise the awareness of Data Management and Data Governance principles and practices across the data, product and operational lifecycles.
Continuous expansion of the understanding and adoption of Data Management best practices across areas of the Bank.
Ensure data-related practices, processes and controls align to the Bank’s data policy and are clearly documented, visible and accessible.
Be a primary contact on data-related matters, stemming from existing subject matter expertise and a continuous improved understanding of the data landscape across the Bank.
Raising awareness and opportunities for new and alternative approaches and tools.
Provide training and support to others outside of DAT, such as data stewards, in areas relating to Data Management, including MDM, Data Governance and Data Registration (cataloguing).
Join and on occasion lead or chair some of the Bank’s data boards and project working groups where Data Management expertise is required.
Liaise with internal and external stakeholders to understand data systems and specific datasets better; as well as their data-related problem areas. Formulate opportunities to improve them.
Provide a positive contribution to the wider team, their meetings and ad-hoc team endeavours.

Role Requirements

Essential Criteria
Data and data systems subject matter expertise.
Detailed experience in at least two of the following Data Management knowledge areas:
Data Governance
Master Data, Reference Data & Metadata Management
Data Quality
Data Architecture & Modelling
Data Integration & Interpretability
Data Storage & Operations
Security, Compliance and Data Protection
Experience of imparting knowledge, advice and guidance to other business areas and being a go-to person for you subject matter expertise.
Experience of improving or fulling resolving data or data systems problem areas.
Previous hands-on experience working with data (e.g. as a data analyst, data scientist, data engineer etc) to understand the nuance of data and data systems incidents and issues.
Experience of working with and managing stakeholders across reporting boundaries; developing strong and effective working relationships.
Experience of drafting documentation such as policies, standards and other related artefacts.
An understanding of the risks associated with poor Data Management, and how it impacts business outputs and objectives downstream.
An ability to align multiple stakeholders through informal influence as well as governance.
Strong communication skills, both verbally and written, to influence decisions.
Able to chair meetings to senior managers and deliver presentations with impact and clarity.
Experience formulating plans and creating roadmaps to meet long-term business objectives.
Experience of mentoring, coaching, and developing other staff, including imparting knowledge.
Business analyst skills such as problem solving and critical thinking.
Self-sufficient and proactive attitude managing one’s own workload.
Adaptable to changing business needs with minimal fuss or objection.
A willingness to receive personal feedback, in order to adapt, improve or learn.
A genuine passion and positive appreciation of the need for Data Management.

Desirable Criteria
An understanding of the pain-points and resolutions to users finding, accessing, sharing and trusting data.
Knowledge of established Data Management frameworks and best practice approaches.
Experience shaping or implementing a data strategy or data change programme.
Experience of completing Data Management Framework assessments or data capability maturity assessments.
An understanding of data migration strategies and foresight of implementation issues.
Understand the concept and benefits of data lakes and data warehousing.
Experience of working in a Chief Data Office or a data related programme or project.
Experience of working with data in the financial services industry.
Ability to analyse and visualise data through languages and tools (e.g. SQL, R, Python & Tableau).
Experience of influencing without authority and using persuasion to get things done.

We’re looking for motivated, experienced and enthusiastic HCPC registered Specialist Biomedical Scientist Section Lead to join The Virology Department at University Hospital Southampton NHS Foundation Trust (UHS).

ABOUT THE TEAM

The UHS Pathology Department offers a 27/7, 365 day clinical and laboratory service to UHS, GPs in the local area and specialist tests to other hospitals throughout the UK. We are a regional, supra-regional and national specialist service provider. Each pathology department works closely together and with our service users to provide excellent service to our patients.

Microbiology processes over 600,000 specimens per annum and employs over 70 staff. It provides a comprehensive service covering bacteriology, mycobacteriology, mycology, virology, serology and parasitology, and has a well-equipped molecular facility. As a section lead, you will be expected to work throughout all of sections of the Bacteriology Department on a rotational basis and will be required to work evenings, weekends, and Public holidays and participate in the on-call rota as rostered.

WHAT YOU’LL DO

Lead sections of the laboratory team; providing a high level of Microbiological analysis in order to provide patients with the highest level of diagnosis and treatment.
Be responsible for the efficient day-to-day running of in a section of the laboratory and co-ordinate staff deployment and rotation.
Lead on all aspects of quality management in a section of the laboratory, including implementation of new methods.
Supervise and train inexperienced BMS, trainee BMS or MLA staff and assist in training plans.

WHAT WE’RE LOOKING FOR

Demonstrable practical leadership in a virology laboratory and have comprehensive specialist molecular and serology experience.
Someone who is able to communicate well with staff in the department and service users
You must be able to plan and use your own time economically and effectively
A high degree of motivation and enthusiasm is essential for the role
Commitment to and focus on quality, demonstrates high standards in all that you do

WHAT WE CAN OFFER YOU

As one of the largest acute teaching Trust’s in England, we can offer learning and development opportunities to help you achieve the career you aspire to. We believe you deserve the best possible surroundings in which to do your job and we want to support you in doing your job to the best of your ability.

As a Trust, we support flexible working and will consider requests taking into account the needs of the service. You’ll have an opportunity to discuss this at interview. Our LiveWell and inspire programme offers opportunities, support and advice, including smoking cessation services, exercise and activity classes, and support for mental health.

UHS employees are able to access a huge range of NHS discounts, are entitled to a minimum of 35 days paid holiday (pro rata) on appointment, can access on-site nursery facilities (subject to availability), and we offer a generous pension scheme.

ABOUT OUR TRUST AND SOUTHAMPTON

UHS is rated ‘Good’ by the CQC and in the latest national NHS Staff Survey, we were in the top 10 acute trusts for staff engagement and for staff recommending the hospital as a place to work or receive care.

Southampton is an attractive place to live and work situated on the south coast, with an international airport and only an hour on the train from central London. The New Forest National Park and the beaches of the Jurassic coast are also right on our doorstep. The city offers living costs 20% lower than those in London, 13 schools rated outstanding by Ofsted and 13 nearby green spaces to enjoy.

ADDITIONAL INFORMATION

Interview date 25th August 2020.

Please note if sufficient suitable candidates apply, we may choose to close the application process early.

Our mission is to break down the barriers of today to release the potential of tomorrow. Join us today and release yours.
About this role
You’ll be working in BT’s Data & AI Solutions business. Part of BT Strategy and Transformation, the team has big growth ambitions centred on building innovative, customer-centric propositions that are underpinned by data & AI. This is an exciting and diverse business unit, full of talented people with an entrepreneurial attitude. We’re doing something new within BT, with the significant digital, data and brand strengths of BT to draw on. Your working dataset is one of the richest and most exciting in the UK with a unique blend of first party data from BT and EE, which will allow you to produce incredibly impactful data products. You will use a cutting-edge platform (GCP) and toolset. You will be a senior technical lead for Data & AI Solutions, working closely with the product and commercial teams to understand customer needs and develop ground-breaking solutions to address those needs.

Ultimately you will be leveraging various AI approaches to enrich business solutions, develop and deliver market leading analytical solutions and products for external clients, to drive a new revenue stream for BT.

You'll have the following responsibilities
Lead the enhancement of the current data capabilities and create new analytical products using various statistical and AI techniques
Responsible for the management and delivery of key client projects making sure they are delivered on time and to budget
Working with the commercial sales and product management team to agree and prioritise client deliverables and new product development workstreams
Supporting the sales team and working directly with clients to understand and translate their business requirements into actionable data insights
Building and delivering analytical solutions by analysing large and complex data sets using multiple technologies (BigQuery, GCP, Python, R, Spark)
Visualising analytical results in insightful and interactive ways using various technologies
Ownership of 3rd party technology provider relationships
Management, coaching and mentoring other data scientists and engineers
Accountable for business case development, budget spend and forecasting

You'll have the following skills & experience

Must have:
Detailed knowledge of a range of AI techniques including supervised and unsupervised machine learning techniques such as deep learning, graph data analytics, neural networks & natural language processing
Team management and development experience
Experience with Cloud computing on the GCP platform, SQL proficiency
Strong experience with statistical analysis using Python (preferable) or R
Knowledge of data visualisation fundamentals
Experience of working directly with clients and sales teams to understand client requirements and translate them into solutions
Competent in designing and building innovative data and AI products
Experience in commercialising analytics products to external clients
Strong communication and data presentation skills with the ability to build convincing recommendations and sell these to a non-technical audience
Experience in developing senior stake holder relationships
Flexible and agile work skills - comfortable working in a fast paced, highly collaborative, dynamic work environment
Hold a PhD in Computer Science, or related technical, science or other numerate discipline

Preferred:
Experience of geospatial principles and techniques
Wide experience of big data technologies: cloud computing, containerisation, analytics engines (Spark, Elasticsearch)
Experience in delivering location planning, transport, retail, marketing or web analytics

15" target bonus, cash/car allowance, private healthcare, competitive pension, 10 x life assurance, 25 days AL and many more

BT has a key role in British society, fostering change and leading technology innovation. From delivering the Olympics, to supporting the emergency services, to investing more into research than any other UK technology company, we take pride in everything we do - and in the people who work here.

Data Scientist – Causality Expert



Job description

Summary

We are looking for a motivated and high-achieving Data Scientist – Causality Expert based in London to join the team working on our exciting machine learning product. This is a full-time placement with significant opportunities for personal development.

We offer an intellectually stimulating environment, work within an interdisciplinary team and an inclusive culture. We are a high-calibre, mission-driven team building a technology that improves our world.

The Company

causaLens is pioneering a completely new approach to time-series prediction. Its Enterprise Platform is used to transform and optimise businesses that need accurate and robust predictions – including significant businesses in finance, IoT, energy and telecoms. Almost all current machine learning approaches, including AutoML solutions, severely overfit on time-series problems and therefore fail to unlock the true potential of AI for the enterprise. causaLens was founded with the mission to devise Causal AI, which does not overfit, and so provides far more reliable and accurate predictions. The platform also includes capabilities such as autonomous data cleaning and searching, autonomous model discovery and end-to-end streaming productisation.

causaLens is on a mission to build truly intelligent machines that go beyond current machine learning approaches - a curve-fitting exercise. Devising Causal AI has allowed us to teach machines cause and effect for the first time - a major step towards true AI.

causaLens is run by scientists and engineers, the majority holding a PhD in a quantitative field. For more information visit www.causaLens.com or contact us on info@causaLens.com. Follow us on LinkedIn and Twitter.

UK Companies’ - Hotwire

Roles and Responsibilities

This is an exciting role for a smart, creative person to become our in-house causality - causal inference expert. You will be leading all causality related research projects.

The opportunity to join a fast-growing, agile, and international team passionate about innovation and making a difference

Job requirements

This role is open for candidates of all seniorities, junior to senior.
PhD research and experience in causal inference necessary
Creativity and ability to come up with ideas to tackle very hard problems and design/implement cutting edge solutions
Very advanced quantitative skills in machine learning/statistics/mathematics or similar fields

Highly capable, self-motivated, collaborative and personable
Ability to demonstrate integrity and drive
Naturally curious and effective problem solver

What is Slice?

Slice is the leading technology and marketing platform made exclusively for local pizzerias, making it super easy to order delicious, authentic local pizza anywhere, anytime. We serve the $44 billion U.S. pizzeria market in two ways: by providing a pizza-centric mobile and web ordering experience for consumers, and by empowering local restaurants with the technology, tools, and marketing to grow their business, while helping them compete with Big Pizza. Can you imagine what a small mom and pop pizza shop could achieve with the resources of Domino's?

Slice was born in 2011 and has quietly bootstrapped its way to building a network of more than 10,000 pizzerias nationwide. Ilir Sela, our founder and CEO, started the company as a passion project to help his friends and family in the pizza business, but he quickly saw a massive opportunity to champion these small businesses by bringing their bites to the masses. Ilir has since built an amazing team of operators, marketers, technologists, and investors — all dedicated to making it easier for people to enjoy their favourite local pizza.

What you'll do.
Leverage your quantitative expertise to understand how Slice can apply supply and demand levers to unlock marketplace opportunities; techniques will include experiment design, predictive modelling, observational analysis, pattern recognition and any others as needed
Partner with Product and Marketing teams to set clear goals, measure progress against them and influence their respective roadmaps
Ensure consistent tracking, analysis, and reporting of core product and marketing programs and channel KPIs in weekly dashboards
Build and maintain executive dashboards in Looker
Improve the accessibility and organisation of data
Collaborate with Data Engineering to understand all data flows, build new flows as needed and create appropriate data dictionaries for business users
Simplify complex raw data into user friendly explores, looks, and dashboards for audiences across the organization
Perform complex ad-hoc data and analysis requests
What we're looking for:
BSc in a quantitative discipline (MSc preferred)
4+ years of specialised experience in Data Science or Advanced Analytics solving complex analytical problems in a technology environment
Proficiency in Python and SQL
Fluency in at least one statistical software (R preferred), Excel and at least one visualisation tool (Looker, Mode, Tableau, etc.)
Strong data modelling and transformation skills
Excellent verbal and written communication skills
Strong communication skills
Able to clearly express opinions on product design, while respecting the thoughts and opinions of their peers.
Proven ability to communicate and collaborate effectively with engineers and non-engineering stakeholders alike
Interested?

We operate like a startup, so being self-motivated, curious, and flexible is a good start. You prefer to come up with your own solutions to problems but are not afraid to ask for help. You enjoy making suggestions for how to improve our product and business, no matter the department. You're the kind of person who roots for the underdog. And lastly, this job will probably be a lot easier if you have a soulmate-level love for authentic pizza.

Why Slice?

Join a community of best-in-class engineers who combine creativity, curious minds and a commitment to excellence with the desire and commitment to grow and build on the engineering skill base and community here in NI. Missing a few of the criteria but have worked in a pizza shop? Why not get in touch!
